1.content:
Groaning, I wake up somewhere I don't recognize. Everything is a blur. My surroundings, my memories of how I got here. Hell, my memories period. I can't seem to remember anything but this throbbing headache.

I look around, trying to make sense of where I am, but I'm met only with blurs as my eyes adjust. Whatever it is, wherever I am, I'm lost and pretty helpless. I hope there's someone around who can help.

"Hello?"

I call out, looking around as my vision starts to improve, slowly but noticeably. My head is still throbbing as I listen for an answer, but there is none. I sigh. Looks like I'm alone, at least for now. Trying to stand, I find that my balance is about as good as my vision right now, toppling over and falling on my ass.

"What a night I must have had..."

I sigh once more, closing my eyes and just waiting for my head to stop spinning. Once this headache came down a bit, I could start worrying about where I was. For now, I just wanted a few aspirin and a nap.

Several minutes passed. The thumping in my brain became a dull thud gradually, as I sat and thought, trying to piece things together one bit at a time. My name was Jake...yes, that was right. I was around 5'10". Not the shortest guy in the world, but I certainly wasn't looking down on many people. Brown hair, obnoxiously curly. I touched my head to confirm this and nodded. Come to think of it, why am I thinking all this in the past tense. Not like any of it would have changed...right?

I laugh a little at the question. Hell, with this headache, my lack of a memory, and this messy blur of my senses, I wouldn't know it if I were an inch tall. Somehow, this joke hits a little hard, and I shiver a bit. "Let's just...set that thought aside."

Several more minutes had passed, and when I opened my eyes, I found I could practically see again.

That's when they appeared.
1.title: Humble Beginnings

11.content:
“And they call this a bestseller? What a joke,” I scoffed, as I flopped down on my bed with the latest swords-and-sorcery paperback in hand. The main character was a typical Mary Sue, but at least the cover art was attractive. Brushing my black hair out of my eyes, I flipped it open and began to read, but the first few pages were so boring that I tossed the book aside and rolled over onto my back. Sighing, I draped my head upside-down over the foot of the bed, looking around for something to do. My eyes pass over my cluttered bedroom, stopping at my collection of porcelain dolls lined up against the baseboard. A relic from my childhood, most people would probably think them creepy. I never have anyone over anyway, so what’s the use in keeping them around? My mother always used to get them for me at garage sales and such when I was a kid, and even now she occasionally brings home a “find”. She always called me her “little doll” because of my pale skin and straight dark hair.

As my eyes passed over the messy stacks of books everywhere, I noticed some movement out of the corner of my eye. Startled, I rolled over onto my stomach. Everything went black! Wait, that’s just my bangs in my eyes. Brushing them aside, I slowly gazed around, looking for that little movement again. It’s probably just my overactive imagination at work. Too much reading about giant robots and mythical creatures, I guess. Before I could turn away, a fluttering doll dress caught my attention. It’s a calm night, so there shouldn’t be a breeze in here. A small creature emerged from under the dress. It seemed to be looking around, confused. Hoping not to startle it, I slowly stood up from the bed.

A chill ran through my body, and it wasn’t from my bare feet against the hardwood floor. I smoothed my nightgown with my hands as I watched the tiny thing explore its surroundings. It seemed to show some intelligence, unlike the animalistic movements of a rodent. Even in the weak light cast by my nightstand lamp, I could tell it had a human-like figure. Could it be a tiny person? No way, that only happens in stories. I wonder if it saw me yet…
11.title: The bookworm

111.content:
Finally, I could see again. But looking around me, there really wasn't a whole lot to see. From the look of things, I was under what looked like a big tent. A big, very dark tent. With nothing else inside, save for the two thick posts holding it up. "I didn't join some mopey circus, did I?"

Standing up, more cautiously this time, I find that my legs are willing to support me again. "Well, let's see where this bastard's carnival was set up..." I could barely see a thing in the darkness, but I did notice the tent raised a little bit at one end, letting in a tiny bit of light, and that marked an easy destination. I take a step, and then another, carefully feeling out the ground before me, not wanting to trip over anything and knock myself unconscious again. Something told me I'd been asleep for long enough already.

The end of the tent was closer than it had seemed. Taking hold of the bottom of it, I hoisted it over my head and stepped outside, expecting the breeze of cool night air on my face and finding it room temperature at best. Odd. "Well then, where...am...I...?"

My words trailed off as I looked around. It was dark here, but not as bad as under the tent. I could see, but what I was seeing I couldn't believe. It looked like a bedroom. A giant bedroom! I took a few more steps away from the tent, head jutting about in every direction as I tried to make sense of this. Turning back to look at the tent, I gaped and fell backward, staring up at an enormous porcelain doll. This wasn't happening. This couldn't be happening... Turning around and looking once more at the impossibly large room, I froze. My eyes landed on an equally impossibly large girl who was staring right back at me. Alright. Don't panic...calmly step back and hide under the doll's dress. Maybe she hasn't actually noticed you yet.

I took a slow, nervous step back, not breaking eye contact. Then another. Then I freaked, and ran for cover under the doll, stumbling in the dark and falling over as I tripped on one of its feet. I laid there, practically right back where I started, hoping against hope she wasn't going to come...eat me, or grind my bones for bread, or some other cliche.

I laid there. And waited...
111.title: Getting a Read on Things

1111.content:
I couldn’t believe my eyes. There, as if in a dream, was a little person, right in front of me. Judging from his messy brown hair and wide shoulders, it was a boy, perhaps a year or two older than me. We locked eyes for a split second before he scampered back under the dress. In his haste, he tripped and fell. I stifled a giggle, before I realized that he might be afraid of me. Of course, I would never hurt such a defenseless creature, but it might be fun to play with him a little…

I sat down in front of the doll with my feet against the baseboard, my legs cutting off any escape route. There were still no stirrings of movement coming from under the doll, so I would have to coax him to come out. Gingerly lifting up the dress, I saw he was on his knees with his back toward me, his shapely rear in the air and his forehead touching the floor. It was as if he was hoping if he closed his eyes hard enough, this surreal situation would simply vanish into thin air.

Unfortunately for him, I wasn’t going anywhere. I placed my hand near him, my fingers poking under the dress and my palm outside. “If you don’t want to be my breakfast, then you better climb into my hand!” I declared, in my most authoritative voice. I had to try not to laugh at my own poor acting skills. I waited to feel any sensation of little hands on my fingers.
1111.title: Fi fi fo fum...

11111.content:
As I cowered under the skirt, I considered my situation. Giant girl. Giant girls' room. Hiding under a toy of the giant girl while she knows where I am. This...was not my brightest plan.

Despite that, my body didn't want to move, it seemed. Not when I thought I heard her giggle, not when I heard her moving around outside, doing something, and not when my hiding place started to light up a little as she lifted the skirt.

I peeked at her from between my legs, seeing her fingers slip in after me. That was when I moved. I bolted, hiding behind the leg of the doll. Then I heard her voice.

"If you don't want to be my breakfast, then you better climb in my hand!"

I winced, then gulped, staring at her expectant fingers as I considered my options. If I tried to run, I was breakfast. There was no way I was getting away from her. Even hiding, all she has to do was pick up the doll and give it a once-over to see me. I let out a long, low sigh, resigning myself to my apparent fate as I stepped over to her hand.

I took a deep breath and stepped onto it, sitting in the middle of her palm gently, waiting for her to do...whatever it was she intended to do to me. My fate was, quite literally, in her hands.

I really hoped she wouldn't eat me...
11111.title: Oh God, She's Really Going to Eat Me

111111.content:
I could feel tiny footfalls on my hand as he stepped aboard. It must be truly frightening for him, waking up shrunken in a stranger’s house, with no idea what horrors could befall him. He must place a lot of trust in me, trust I would do well not to abuse. But still, it would be fun to play with him a little.

Once I felt him settle down in my palm, I gently lifted him up to my face. I could feel him fidgeting a bit, probably trying to keep his balance. As he passed my chin, I slowly opened my mouth as wide as it could go. I bet he had quite of a view of my pink lips and straight white teeth. “Silly, I don’t eat my dolls,” I said, as I closed my mouth and pulled my hand away to get a better look at him. He wore a brave face, but the slight trembles that I felt on my palm indicated that he was a bit shaken up. He seemed to stare up at me expectantly, as if he was unsure how to make the first move.

“People introduce each other when they meet, right? At least, that’s what they do on TV. Anyway, my name is-“

A noise from the hallway caught my attention. I only live with one other person and the creak of floorboards could only mean one thing. Glancing around the room, I tried to find a good hiding spot for him. A bare spot on a shelf otherwise filled with anime figurines looked like the best bet. I placed him down on the wooden shelf as gently as I could, placing a finger to my lips to encourage him to keep quiet. I flopped back onto my bed and flipped my book open to a random page as a sharp knock on the door reverberated through the room.

“Come in!” I chirped happily, trying not to glance over at the tiny boy across the room.

With a loud creak, the door opened and my mother stepped through. Unlike me, she kept her black hair kept short and close to her neck. Even dressed in a simple robe and ready for bed, she has a preternatural beauty about her. I swear, it’s almost like she uses magic to keep herself looking so young.

“Are you going to sleep soon?” she asked, sitting down next to me on the bed. “Don’t forget, you have school in the morning.”

“Yes, mother,” I answered, burying my face in my book.

“Keep in mind that we’re going to start looking at colleges this weekend as well,” she said, as she began to stroke my hair. “Iris, have you decided on a major yet?”

“No, mother,” I replied. My nose was up against the book’s spine now.

“Well, keep thinking about it. I can’t believe it; soon my little doll will be all grown up!” She kissed me on the top of the head before we bid each other good night. Once the door was securely closed, I bounded up from the bed and rushed over towards the little guy. He looked comically out of place next to the scantily-clad warrior woman figurine next to him, but at least he was holding a spare plastic sword out in front of him to look the part. Maybe sometimes hiding in plain sight is the best option.

“Well, as you heard, my name is Iris. What’s yours? And how did you get here?”
111111.title: Shelved

1111111.content:
Settling myself into her hand, I took a deep breath. Then she started to lift me. I ducked under the edge of the dress as it threatened to clothesline me and knock me back under the doll. The last thing I wanted to do was accidentally disobey this girl right now.

Up I went, lifted toward her face as I took in the sight of the girl again. She was cute, I had to admit. Maybe a year or two younger than me. Pale with long dark hair. Enchanting, some might say. But some weren't in a position to be eaten by said girl.

As I passed her chin, she opened her mouth wide and I winced back, seeing far too much of her teeth for comfort and throwing my arms up to shield myself. As if it would stop her from tossing me inside and devouring me whole. At least it blocked the view.

But after a few seconds, it seemed she wasn't going to and I lowered my arms, seeing her now closed mouth as I was lifted a little further and she taunted me a little. A doll? Is that what I was to her?

She kept talking, very politely for talking to someone who might become her breakfast... But just as she was introducing herself, she seemed to hear something and started glancing around the room, settling on something and depositing me on a shelf as gently as she'd lifted me, signalling me to be quiet.

I wasn't sure what to think at this point, but I nodded to her. God knows I didn't need to go drawing attention to myself and making trouble. I looked around the shelf, left between two anime figures in a row. To my side I saw a sword that seemed to have fallen out of one's grip. A katana. Thinking fast, I grabbed it, posing to fit in. I held the katana above me in one hand, placing the other hand on my hip in the stance a certain moss-headed swordsman had taken when he thought he'd become a statue. But I digress.

In the door came another woman. She looked like the girl I'd been dealing with but older and with shorter hair. She had an elegant beauty about her. It seemed like a family trait.

I watched the two converse, the girl, identified as Iris by her mother, occasionally glancing in my direction but clearly trying not to. I didn't move a muscle though I did listen curiously, learning a little about her. As Iris's mother left, she called her her little doll and I got the feeling I knew where all the dolls by her bed had come from.

When she left, Iris came back over to me. I sighed, letting my am down but keeping my hold on the sword as she picked back up on introductions, asking me a few questions.

I swallowed and found my voice finally. "My name's Jake. As for how I got here, your guess is as good as mine. I can't remember anything recent. How I got here, how I got so small..." I really wanted to believe she was just a giant, but it just made sense that I was the one who was tiny. "Nothing at all. I'd tell you more if I could."

I shrugged, looking up at Iris. "So what happens now?"
1111111.title: Introductions

11111111.content:
“You must be exhausted after all this excitement. If you’re hungry, I can whip something up,” I said, putting my hand out for Jake to step aboard. I noticed he climbed on with a little less trepidation this time. “If you’re lucky, maybe you’ll be dessert.”

That was a joke, of course, but I could swear I felt him shake a little. Must be my imagination.

I held him close to my stomach as I walked towards my door. I could still see him clearly, since I’m flat as a washboard. The girls at school make fun of me for it, but everyone grows at a different rate, right?!

I slipped my feet into a pair of fuzzy pink slippers beside my bed before entering the hallway. It’s an big, old, creaky house with a few unused rooms. I had to pass by my mother’s bedroom before I could enter the kitchen. She’ll probably think I was just getting a midnight snack or something. Probably. Nothing to do with tiny guys, certainly.

The lights flickered into life as I flicked the switch, illuminating a rather cluttered table centered in a large kitchen. I set Jake down onto the checkered tablecloth next to a stack of old books as I rummaged through the shelves, looking for something quick to eat. I found a large iron pot sitting on top of a shelf. It would be perfect for stir-frying. I peeked inside the fridge to see what kind of ingredients we had. Some leftover meat, a little bit of vegetables… should be enough for a small meal. Plus, it would be nice cooking practice.

“This will just take a sec, ok?”

After heating and oiling the pan, I added the ingredients. Turning back to Jake, I saw he was making himself comfortable on the table.

“It’s just me and mom living here now, so you won’t have to worry about anyone else discovering you. Oh, there’s also my cat, but he’s fat and lazy, so you shouldn’t have to worry about him! Whoops, food’s almost ready.”

Somehow, in the space of a few seconds, seemingly innocuous ingredients were transmogrified into a discolored lump. I think I just have bad luck when it comes to cooking. Oh well, practice makes perfect, right? I dumped it out onto a single plate. I figure we can share it, no need to dirty any more dishes.

“It might look a little strange,” I said, as smoke rose from the food pile. “But it’s still edible! Right?”
11111111.title: Snacks

111111111.content:
As if on cue, my stomach growled and I recalled I hadn't eaten in...damn, when did I eat last? Before I blacked out and got tiny, at least. And who knows how far back that was. "Food sounds great, actually."

Then Iris mentioned I might be desert, and a chill ran up my spine. She was joking again, right? She's...she's been joking, right? I tried not to think too hard about it as she carried me out of her bedroom. She was holding me close to her stomach, but looking up I could see straight to her face. Rather flat chest if I'm going to be blunt, but far be it from me to hold something so vain against a lady. Particularly one who may be considering me as a second course.

I could feel her body heat a bit held this close, and it was nice. Made for a pleasant trip through the creaky house. I looked around, examining it in the dark and trying to recall if I'd ever seen it before. But nothing rung a bell. It was all new to me.

Soon, we arrived in the kitchen. Iris set me down on the table and set about finding something to cook. Holding a pile of ingredients, she let me know it'd be quick. "Hey, take your time. I'm certainly not gonna rush you..."

Especially when I might be next... I pushed that thought away again, looking around. My eyes fell on the stack of old books beside me, glancing over them for any I might know. An author or two I thought I might have heard of, but nothing I'd read personally.

Iris explained her family situation. I froze when she mentioned a cat, then relaxed a little when she explained it was lazy. I'd known cats like that. I was sure I'd be fine Chekhov's gun didn't apply to reality, after all, did it?

When she exclaimed that food was done, I was a little taken aback. That was damned quick. But as she scooped it onto the plate, I began to understand. It looked like something you might see in an old movie based on a Lovecraft story. A b-movie shoggoth.

I stared at it as she set it in front of me, apparently expecting me to test it. The alternative if it wasn't good certainly wasn't better for me. So I crawled onto the plate to reach it, pulling a piece off of the now smoking shoggoth and popping it into my mouth.

It was...not as terrible as I'd expected. It was downright edible, though the flavors had mixed in a strange way. I nodded my approval, looking up at her. "You're not gonna win any cooking contests with it, but it's definitely not bad."

I grabbed another piece and motioned for her to try some, taking a step back away from it just in case she got any ideas.
111111111.title: A Midnight Snack

1111111111.content:
Even though my meal looked like something dredged up from the deep sea, Jake bravely took a bite. He seemed to like it, or at least it wasn’t too disagreeable. After he took a step back, I grabbed a bite for myself. He was certainly right about the flavor being… original. As I swirled it around my mouth, I could taste the distinct flavors of undersea monster and motor oil. Well, at least it’s healthy, right?!

Still, runners-up don’t belong in the fridge. Tossing the smoldering remnants in the trash, I stole a glance at the clock. I really should be going to bed soon. But hygiene is important, and I certainly can’t tuck-in without washing up first.

“It’s time for bed, and everyone knows you have to brush your teeth first!” I said, letting Jake climb back into my hand and gently carried him into the bathroom. It was an ornate, brassy space, with old mirrors and ivory handles. I set him down on the cool marble countertop. Hmm, what can a tiny guy use to wash his face? Aha, a damp washcloth should do the trick! I just hope he’s strong enough to lift it.

“Here you go! Wash your face before bed, or else you’ll have dirty dreams!” I said, as I wrung out the washcloth and handed it to him. While he wiped himself off, I looked at myself in the mirror. My own green eyes peeked out from under my long bangs. I really should get my beauty sleep soon. I grabbed my toothbrush and began to brush my teeth; after all, a healthy smile is important. As I was brushing, I felt something strange near my back molars. I tried to touch it with my tongue, but I couldn’t feel anything. Strange. Maybe Jake can take a look? I bent down closer to him.

“Hey, I think there’s something stuck in my teeth,” I said, opening wide. “See anything?”
1111111111.title: Cleaning up

choices: Can you get it with direction?
11111111111.content:
I couldn't say I was sad to see the edible shoggoth thrown away and Iris didn't seem too torn up over it either. But she was starting to look tired as she checked out the clock, then turned to me and declared it was bed time and we were brushing our teeth.

I was in no position to argue, so I climbed into her presented hand and let her bring me to the bathroom with her, standing on the counter and looking around at the fancy set-up. Brass and antique mirrors everywhere you looked. This place was so fancy, it was almost like one of those crazy expensive doll houses. But I figured it might be better not to mention that.

Iris set a damp washcloth before me explaining to wash my face. I'd never really heard this before, but I certainly wasn't going to let her think I was going to have dirty dreams. Somehow, that felt inadvisable. So I lifted a corner of the washcloth and diligently scrubbed my face with it.

When I finished, I looked up and watched you brush your teeth. That might be a little more difficult for me at this point. Pretty sure the head of a toothbrush was bigger than my own head at this point. iris looked like she was being bothered by something in her mouth, and as she turned to me, I shivered a little.

She asked me to have a look and opened wide. I got a nice deep view of her mouth, not wanting to move any closer. But it did look like there was something stuck in there. Between some of her bottom molars, sticking out the outer side of the teeth. A remnant of some past meal I couldn't quite make out.

"On that side," I pointed toward it, really hoping she could pull it out on her own. "On the bottom outside. Maybe halfway back."

I almost wanted to reach in and grab it before she could invite me in and try something. But it seemed pretty damned rude to climb into someone's mouth without specific invitation. And besides, she wouldn't try to trick me like this, would she? I'd seen this in a few too many cartoons to fall for it. No matter how pretty the girl trying it was...and no matter if she couldn't get it herself...and. And...god damn it, if she asked, I was gonna have to go in there. Damn you, chivalry.
11111111111.title: Way too obvious to be a trap...right?

111111111111.content:
Jake’s hands flailed wildly as he tried to point out where the obstruction in my mouth was located. Over here? No…? Back further? Try as I might, I just couldn’t dig it out. My fingers kept slipping off. His hands kept flailing as if he was trying to wave in a landing airplane.

He was almost close enough to gobble up. But that would certainly be rude. Perhaps he would be gallant enough to climb in and dig it out?

“You would be my brave little hero if you could venture into this dangerous cave and retrieve the treasure hidden within!”

After he nodded his acquiescence, Jake stripped down to his underwear. No sense getting his clothing all soaked, right? He was a little toned, more than adequate to face the task at hand. I placed my hand on the counter and let him climb aboard. He seemed to be getting used to this. I raised my hand to my face and swallowed my saliva. I should make my mouth as hospitable as possible before he sallied forth. Obviously I wasn’t about to just dump him inside, so I slowly parted my lips and rolled my tongue out until the tip touched my palm. Jake flexed his muscles to psych himself up, and then tentatively reached out with a hand. His tiny little touch felt so surreal it sent shockwaves up my spine, sending my tongue into a twitching fit. It reared up like a serpent and whacked poor Jake onto his bum.

Gasping, I peered down at him, hoping he wasn’t hurt. Fortunately, he was slightly damp but otherwise fine. After he gave a thumbs-up, I stuck out my tongue again. This time, I braced myself and kept my tongue steady as he crawled deeper. I watched his progress in the mirror as he inched forward on his hands and knees. Once he was settled in, I slowly retracted my tongue into my mouth. I kept my lips open as wide as possible to give him enough light, so that this cavern didn’t seem too eerie.

Jake looked out of my parted lips at his own reflection in the mirror. I could feel him shudder at bit at the sight. In fact, I could feel every breath and movement he made. He then glanced at the back of my throat, towards the dangling uvula signifying the gateway to an even deeper chasm. I tried to keep my tongue as still as possible, but it would still tremble enough to threaten to knock him off balance. Eventually, Jake made his way over to my molars, which he gingerly climbed over, swinging one leg over first and then the other. Once he was tucked in my cheek, I could no longer see him, but I could certainly feel him moving around. His feet dug into my flesh for grip as he struggled to remove the stubborn piece of food.

By now, a copious amount of saliva had built up in my mouth. It was just a natural reaction, not because I was trying to taste him…. Really! I think I even felt him fall over once or twice. In any case, Jake finally dislodged the “treasure” and held it over his head triumphantly. He made his way back across my tongue, slipping and sliding all the while. Finally, he made it to my front teeth, whereupon I unceremoniously spat him out into my palm.

“Congratulations! The brave knight has returned with the treasure! Ah, but you can just toss it in the sink,” I said, as Jake heaved it over the edge of my hand. It landed in the porcelain bowl and I rinsed it away. Jake looked adorable with his slimy, matted hair, and he couldn’t wait to clean himself off again. But it wouldn’t do to sleep in those ratty clothes anyway, so we should try to find him some pajamas. I’m sure I must have something that would fit him mixed in with all the doll clothes.
111111111111.title: An inside job

choices: What's waiting for me in the doll closet?
1111111111111.content:
No matter where I pointed, how I tried to guide Iris' finger or her tongue, nothing worked. The bit of whatever it was remained firmly stuck in between her teeth, and my options were quickly dwindling. A pit started to grow in my stomach. I knew what was coming next, and when she asked me to climb inside, I was unsurprised. However charming she was, I wasn't looking to this.

"I...suppose I can climb in there and retrieve it. I've got a weakness for beautiful damsels in distress."

I sighed, but nodded anyway. I almost climbed right in as I was, then thought against it. I only had this one set of clothes. Better to keep it somewhat dry and not coated in Iris' drool for when I got out. Trying not to think too hard about it, I began to strip down, pulling off my shirt and then my jeans and revealing my body. I wasn't ripped by any means, but I was fit. And I at least thought I looked pretty good. I set the clothes in a pile, deciding to keep my boxers on. God knows, I'd be making a very different impression if I didn't. I'd rather play the saliva odds.

When Iris presented her hand, I climbed aboard and she lifted me to her mouth. She seemed to be swallowing as much of her spit as she could to dry it out for me. I appreciated that small comfort, but my unease came back as she parted her lips, giving me a closer look inside. When she breathed out, I breathed in, taking in the fresh, minty scent and leaned forward to crawl in. I tried to set my hand on her teeth, getting tongue instead and receiving an abrupt smack in the face that knocked me over back into her palm in response, my face now thoroughly licked.

I blinked in amazement, not expecting that. I looked up at Iris, meeting her concerned gaze and offering a smile and a thumbs up to let her know I was okay. I chuckled a little, deciding to be more careful climbing around in her mouth, lest I get thrown the other way...

This time, Iris opened her mouth wider and stuck out her tongue. I was far more careful entering, testing each movement as I climbed onto it, letting her draw me inside. I turned around, looking out and seeing myself huddled inside her mouth in the mirror. I shuddered a little, frowned and turned away, trying not to think about it and focus on the matter at hand. Carefully, I inched toward the molars where the bit of food was lodged. Every now and again, Iris' tongue would jerk a little and I'd almost be thrown on my side, but each time I managed to maintain my balance and soon I made it my goal. I swung a leg over her teeth, then another, steadying myself between her gums and her cheek as I got a closer look at it.

It was...a piece of a chip, maybe? It was hard to tell. But whatever it was, it had to go. I grabbed it with both hands and began to pull. It didn't want to budge. I pulled and pulled, I jiggled it, all the while losing and regaining my footing on Iris's slippery flesh. As it started to loosen, I noticed now much saliva was building up around me. I was ankle deep in the stuff, and my back and legs were thoroughly soaked. I wished Iris could swallow, but I was also terrified what might happen to me if she did, so I decided in favor of just hurrying up and giving one last, might tug on the chip.

In one swift movement, it came free, I fell backward and slipped, landing face-first in a puddle of drool. I groaned, rolling over and picking myself up, now coated head to toe. I pushed my hair back out of my eyes, the spit all too happy to help hold it in place, and held the chip fragment in one hand. "Finally..."

I climbed over her teeth once more, careful to announce my climbing back onto her tongue with gentle taps before actually getting on and somewhat hastily making for the exit. It was harder now, with only one arm to support myself and being coated in slippery saliva, but I made it to her front teeth once more. Iris spat me out into her hand gently, and I showed her the food piece, grinning triumphantly.

"Your problems are no more, milady." I tossed the food piece away as she said, sitting in her hand and breathing heavily. I tried to adjust my hair, but any semblance of neatness was long gone at this point. I looked at myself, the coating of drool starting to dry in the open air and making me sticky. My boxers weren't going to be dry any time soon. This was a problem. But one I could deal with...

I looked up at Iris. She seemed to be considering my problem too, looking at my clothes with disapproval. I looked at them, then back at her, then remembered the myriad dolls in her room and realized what she was probably considering. I wasn't about to be picky. Anything that fit would do. I just hoped whatever she picked, it wouldn't be a dress...
1111111111111.title: Quest Complete

11111111111111.content:
His adventure having been concluded, it was time to clothe Jake in raiment fit for a knight. Or, at least, whatever I had lying around. I gently cupped him in my hands as I left the bathroom, holding him close to keep him warm. In one corner of my bedroom sat a large chest, like something a pirate would store his treasure inside. Setting Jake down on my bed, I kneeled down and heaved open the heavy lid.

Inside was a cornucopia of doll clothes. Frills and laces intertwined like the roots of some great fabric tree. Sticking my hand deep in the pile of clothes, I pulled up a bundle of dresses. Sorting through them, I tossed away a rainbow of multicolored dresses before I found a pair of pajamas sitting at the bottom of the pile. They looked a bit old-fashioned, with puffy sleeves and bulging leggings, but it was better than a dress, right?

“It looks a bit silly, but it’s all I have,” I said, gathering up Jake in one hand and his new clothes in the other, and brought them to a large, ornate dollhouse in the far corner of my room. The roof hinged open, revealing a surprisingly detailed interior, furnished with ornate carpets, drapes, and tiny silverware. Even the bed was replete with a comforter and sheets. It looked as if an entire Victorian house had been shrunken down. It had everything but running water. I set him down in the master bedroom on the top floor. It was just large enough for Jake to climb off my fingers and onto the bed.

Giving Jake some privacy to get changed, I straightened out my sheets and fluffed the pillow. Well, time to see how he looked in his new clothes. Jake looked like an off-duty buccaneer in his starchy, bulbous outfit, but at least they fit him well.

“Get some good rest, because we have a full day of school tomorrow, and we can’t be late! Good night, Jake!”

After watching him settle into his own bed, I gently closed the dollhouse lid. I let my slippers fall from my feet before climbing under the covers and shutting off the desk lamp. Many thoughts went through my head as I glanced over at the dollhouse, nearly invisible in the darkness. Finding a tiny person is a like something out of a fairytale. He’ll need me to protect him from danger, and I have a new friend now, to boot. I rolled over and shut my eyes, finally letting sleep overtake me.
11111111111111.title: The doll house

111111111111111.content:
From the bed, I watched Iris heave open the veritable pirate chest of doll loot. I used to wonder why anyone would need something like that just to store dolls, but now having seen her collection...well, it made sense. And the colorful mass of clothes she was currently sifting through only confirmed it. Dress after dress, I got a little more worried. But finally, she came to settle on something coming back to me. I hopped into her hand gracefully as she offered it, getting used to the process. I looked at the clothes. A rather poofy pair of pajamas. Not perfect, but they had pants. "This'll do just fine. Thank you, Iris."

I looked on as she carried me...to a doll house. Of course. I laughed a little, somehow not having considered it before this point. But this was no simple doll house. This was the fancy sort of affair that I'd heard of getting passed down generation to generation. When she set me down in the dollhouse, fancier than most real houses I'd been in, I looked around wide-eyed for a few seconds, admiring the scenery. Top notch decoration, I had to say. I looked up to see that she was averting her eyes so I could change. I never liked to keep a lady waiting, so I quickly stripped off my clothing, leaving it in a pile by the doll bed and donning the pajamas.

They actually fit rather well, and I was happy about that. Sure, I looked like I was joining a high school production of The Pirates of Penzance. But these pajamas were surpisingly comfy. I gave Iris the go-ahead, smiling up as she looked back at me. When she spoke, I paused a second, but only a second.

"I will! You sleep well too, Iris. G'night."

I climbed into the bed of the dollhouse, finding to my surprise that despite it being made for dolls, at my size it was actually pretty comfortable. I watched Iris close the lid, then watched her climb into bed through the window, then darkness as she shut off the lamp.

I laced my hands behind my head, staring at the dollhouse ceiling. Her words echoed in my head. We have a full day of school tomorrow. We... I hadn't thought about that. I mean, it made sense. I should be sticking to her like glue, lest her mom find me. Or her cat. And really, it'd be lonely waiting for her. The only real risk was getting discovered by someone or getting separated there. But I mean, what were the odds?

Truth be told, I was living the dream as far as being this tiny went. A mansion all my own, a pretty girl to look after me and protect me, and one who very probably wouldn't eat me, to boot. Things were pretty great for me, all things considered...

I sighed, closing my eyes as the trials of the day took their toll and I slowly drifted off to a sleep I felt was well-deserved.
111111111111111.title: A Night in the Doll House

choices: But how did Jake fare in the bag?
1111111111111111.content:
The shrill buzzing of the alarm clock woke me from a deep slumber. I quickly slapped it off, ceasing its cacophony.

“Mmh… Five more minutes…” I mumbled, rolling over. The next sound I heard was Jake’s voice shouting my name. Did he somehow find his way into my bed? I didn’t roll over on him, did I?! After rubbing my eyes clear, I saw that Jake was leaning over the balcony of his doll house, yelling for all he’s worth. Sunlight streamed in through the window shades behind him. I must’ve really overslept! Tossing off the covers, I threw a blanket over the doll house for some privacy while I got dressed. I put on the standard school uniform: a dark-blue blazer over a white undershirt and necktie, complete with a plaid skirt and black pantyhose.

“Sorry about that, but thanks for waking me up! We have a big day at school today, so let’s get going,” I told Jake, letting him climb off the balcony and into my hand. Placing him on my desk, I grabbed my shoulder bag and cleaned out some of the junk inside, dumping out old erasers and candy bar wrappers. Eventually enough space was cleared for Jake to climb in amongst the books and stationary, supported by a bed of tissues. Hopefully he won’t be shaken around too much. Once Jake was settled in, he gave me a thumbs-up and I smiled back before gently zipping up the bag and hefting it over my shoulder.

Heading into the kitchen, I saw my mom sitting in a bathrobe, reading the morning paper. A steaming cup of coffee sat on the table. The smell made my stomach growl, but I was running late as it is and had to time to eat.

“Good morning, honey! Do you want anything for breakfast?” she asked, as I put on my leather loafers. “Ehh… not today, I have to leave soon,” I replied, setting my bag on the table while I brushed my hair. As soon as I finished, I looked over to see my cat sniffing my bag all up! His massive black form hunched over the bag, his nose buried in a small unzipped section. Could he smell Jake somehow? “Bad boy, Mr. Giggles!” I admonished him, before setting him back on the floor. Kissing my mother goodbye, I grabbed my lunch and ran out the door into the bright morning sunshine.

The slight crispness in the air indicated that summer was on its way out. My house was at the top of a hill, which made walking to school much easier than walking home. The sidewalks were already filled with people, and I even saw a few fellow students. Our uniform is pretty conspicuous. Eventually, I made it to the gates of my school. The bells were already ringing, so I hurried up the stairs and under the big sign proclaiming it to be St. Mary’s Girls’ Academy. It’s the only all-girl school around, and I heard it used to be much more famous, but it’s the school my mother insisted that I attend. Whatever, a school is a school, right?! I quickly opened my locker and unzipped my shoulder bag. In the dim light, I saw Jake was unharmed and still ridiculous in his pajamas. My locker was truly a mess, with balled-up paper and old notes littering its walls. I cleaned out the contents of my soft pencil case, clipping a pen and pencil to my notebook for use in class. It would make a nice travel compartment for Jake. I set the bed of tissues inside the case and urged Jake to hop inside. Once he was secure, I zipped it up and placed it atop the books I would need for the morning. The hallways were nearly empty now. Bounding into homeroom, I took my assigned set next to the window right as roll was being called. Setting the pencil case on my lap, under the desk and out of sight of prying eyes, I unzipped it a tad, letting some light and air in. I smiled down at Jake before returning my attention to the front of the class.
1111111111111111.title: Monday Morning

11111111111111111.content:
When Iris' alarm clock shrieked to life, I groaned, rolling over in the doll bed and covering my ears with the pillow.

"Five more minutes..." Luckily, Iris seemed to agree and it was quickly shut off. I readjusted myself in bed and drifted back off to sleep.

...
...

I woke up with a yawn, looking around at...an incredibly lavish bedroom. It was the doll house. I practically thought I'd dreamed last night, but no. It was clearly very real... I looked out the window and saw Iris peacefully sleeping on her bed. I smiled...wait, didn't she say she had school today? The alarm flashed back into my head. Ooooh, crap... I leapt out of bed, running to the balcony of the dollhouse and shouting. "Iris! Hey, Iris! You have to get up! Time for school!"

She stirred, and sat up sleepily. Success. I watched her realize what time it was and frantically leap out of bed, but then my vision was cut off by a blanket thrown hastily over the house. I was a little offended. She thought I was going to peek at her getting dressed... Or maybe she was just being sure. Either way, I shrugged and waited.

Soon, the sheet was pulled aside and there she stood in the most school uniform school uniform I'd ever seen. Go figure. They do exist... I hopped aboard her offered hand, watching her clear out her bag. I didn't want to climb in there, but there didn't seem to be much option... So when she held it open for me, I slipped inside getting as comfortable as I could. I offered a thumbs up and a smile and she closed the bag, continuing her routine.

From in here, there wasn't much to watch. I was thrown around a little when she moved, but with a little adjusting I was able to prepare for the motions and ride fairly comfortably. I heard muffled conversation, and at one point I heard sniffing and saw the wall of the bag caving in next to me. Her cat? It seemed...big. I really didn't want to see it without a wall between us...

When she began to run, my ride shook more. I supported myself with the walls of the bag and the things inside it, steadying and trying not to be thrown around. I just hoped her school wasn't too far away.

And really, it wasn't. Soon, I heard plenty of girl's voices talking, though I couldn't understand them, and realized this was probably an all-girl's school. The uniform probably should have been a give-away... Still, note to self. Probably the worst place to get separated from Iris? Here. I decided to stick close.

Soon, the bag was opened and Iris transferred me to a pencil case, smaller but emptied out for me and amplified with the tissue bed. It was actually pretty comfy. When she unzipped it sitting in class, I smiled up and confirmed I was okay, then let her focus on class. This was probably going to be a long day for me... I did wonder why today was apparently so special. What school event actually got students excited?

I guess I'd just have to wait and see. I lay down in the bag, crossing my arms behind my head and alternating between looking at Iris and at the ceiling above her. It was all I really had to look at. Nice view, though...
11111111111111111.title: Travel-Size

choices: But is Jake a willing participant?
111111111111111111.content:
Ah, first period was… that’s right, literature class. No sooner did I open my textbook than the clicking of high heels signaled the arrival of Ms. Jones, our teacher. Her hawk-like eyes behind sharp glasses and strict demeanor kept everyone in line, not that I was ever in trouble or anything. Today’s lecture was on various kinds of magic used throughout prose through the ages, from mystics to wizards. I propped my book open on my desk to an illustration of a buxom witch holding a staff. Stifling a yawn, I tried to follow along, but my eyelids soon grew heavy. Certainly I won’t miss anything important if I rest my eyes for a few minutes…

Zzz…

A voice roused me from my inopportune slumber. It seemed to be calling my name. Jolting awake, I realized it was a male voice, impossible in an all-girls school. Where could it be coming from? It was as if someone was magically speaking inside my head. Before I could even turn my head to look, I recognized the voice: Jake. A small touch on my neck told me he must be resting on my shoulder. My brave little knight must’ve climbed up my necktie to rouse me from my slumber again. This seems to be a repeating pattern; hopefully next time won’t be with a kiss. Thankfully, no one seems to have noticed my little guest. Not wanting him to be spotted by a curious onlooker, I adjusted my hair to rest over my shoulders, hiding Jake from view. Trying to become absorbed in the lecture, I tried to keep as still as possible for the rest of the period, lest Jake get knocked off his perch and into a sea of female students. As class finally ending with a discussion of the famous wizard Merlin, I pretended to stretch my arms while I fished Jake out of his hair blanket and secreted him back in his pencil case. I gave him a quick smile before I closed it up, leaving a little bit open for air. I held him close to my chest as I gathered up my things. I was so preoccupied that I didn’t even notice a fellow classmate approach me.

“Hey Iris, what are you going to do for the talent show today?”

Oh yeah, the talent show was this afternoon! I have been practicing my routine for a month now. I have a thrilling magic show planned, except now fate has given me a partner.

“I have something big planned, or should I say small,” I told her, with a chuckle.
111111111111111111.title: Five more minutes...

choices: Just call me a hand-held lovely assistant.
1111111111111111111.content:
For the first ten minutes or so, I was content to lay in the pencil case, looking around and just chilling. I considered taking a nap and just waiting the class out, but I'd slept like a rock last night and now I was wide awake... I sighed, standing, taking hold of the pencil case zipper and pulling myself up to look around. First thing I saw was the textbook, which was about... magic? Damn, if we'd talked about magic in my classes, I might have paid better attention... Especially with illustrations like that. But looking around, it seemed like half the girls weren't interested at all. Can't make everyone happy, I guess...

I drop back into the bag before someone happens to look over and see me and look up to see how Iris is doing. The look I get back isn't a look at all. Her eyes have shut, and her mouth is hanging open just a tad, a very light snoring coming from it. Oh, this is no good. If her teacher saw her sleeping, she was sure to get in trouble. I had to do something. "Iris! Hey, Iris! Wake up!"

I didn't dare yell too loudly, lest I draw the attention of nearby students, but my effort wasn't enough to wake her. I sighed, crossing my arms and considering my options, of which there seemed to be just one. Climb her.

I didn't like it. I didn't want to be out in the open where any wandering eye could spot the tiny man climbing a classmate, but I couldn't leave her to be caught. I took a deep breath and hoisted myself out of the pencil bag, walking closer to Iris. Luckily for me, her tie was hanging down as she slouched, practically laying on the desk. I took hold of the silky fabric, finding that at this size, its fibers made a decent ladder, and started to climb.

I climbed straight up, always looking ahead. I didn't need to see the fall if she were to jerk awake suddenly, or the myriad eyes that could turn at any moment and snatch me off the tie before I ever reached Iris. But luckily, none of that happened, and I made it to her collar with relative ease, crawling from under her chin onto her shoulder and steadying myself. I took hold of her shirt, preparing to be shaken, and called again.

"Iris! Iris, wake up!"

And this time, she did, slowly. My precautions where unnecessary. It took her a moment to realize where my voice was coming from, but when she did, she just smiled, thanking me with her expression and tucking her hair over me to keep me hidden. I sat there, taking in the faint smell of her shampoo and relaxing while the class went on, occasionally nudging her when she looked like she might be nodding off again.

When class ended, I was slipped back into the pencil case, a little sad to move, but it was for the best. She zipped it most of the way, preparing to switch classes, and I overheard her talking to another student.

Talent show? Well, that was one way to get people excited, I guess. She had something... wait, something small? Did she mean me? Of course, I'd be happy to help. But I wondered just what she had in mind for this show... Guess there was only one way to find out. I had to wait and see...

Maybe I could ask next time she set me down.
1111111111111111111.title: No Better Time For a Nap

11111111111111111111.content:
The next two classes passed uneventfully, and soon it was time for lunch. Having skipped breakfast, I was rather famished by this point. Jake could certainly hear my stomach grumbling from his spot in my lap. Hopefully he didn’t think I’d be searching for a tiny snack. Surreptitiously placing the pencil case inside my lunch bag, I made my way outside. It was a fine, sunny day outside, so I decided to eat outside, on the school grounds. We were allowed to eat outside, so long as we didn’t wander off campus.

I made my way over to my favorite spot. A small hill behind the school buildings held a solitary, big old tree that offered a bit of shade and privacy. I usually ate out here alone when the weather cooperated, since I didn’t really have anyone to eat with in the cafeteria. No one wants to sit with the girl that still plays with dolls, after all.

Brimming with anticipation, I eagerly unpacked the lunch my mother made for me. Let’s see… sandwich… banana… cup of baby carrots. No candy, but it looked pretty tasty for something so healthy. I tucked into the sandwich while Jake began to nibble on the carrots. I hope watching me eat didn’t stir up any unpleasant memories for him. He seemed famished, too; who knows how long it was since he had a proper meal. Last night’s culinary “adventure” probably doesn’t count.

Being too hungry to talk, we instead listed to the singing of the birds as we ate. The sounds of laughter and conversation from the other students carried on the wind. Finally, Jake broke the silence while I peeled the banana, asking me about the talent show I mentioned.

“I have a brilliant magic show planned! I sewed my own costume and everything. Except, I’m not too good at the ‘magic’ part yet, so I’ll need some help.” As proof of my preparation, I pulled a tiny outfit out of my bag. It was a full three-piece suit, complete with coattails, a bowtie and top hat. It was everything a dapper little helper would need, perfectly suited to Jake’s size. Hey, it helps to always be prepared.

The pealing of bells indicated that lunch was nearly over. The talent show was next, although we’d have a few minutes to prepare. Gathering up my things, I made sure Jake was safely inside his pencil case before walking back towards school.
11111111111111111111.title: Every student's favorite time

111111111111111111111.content:
For the next two classes, I dozed in the pencil bag, trading off between listening vaguely to the lecture and looking up at Iris and napping to make up for that early morning alarm. By the time lunch rolled around, I was woken my a low grumbling coming from just outside the bag, flinching away from it as I remembered last night and slowly realized what was going on. Iris wasn't going to eat me... at least, not yet. She seemed pretty happy with me outside of her stomach, and she had a talent show she needed me for anyway. I was safe until then.

I waited patiently while she walked to wherever she was going for lunch, popping out of the case when she let me out to see we were outside under a big tree. I took in the fresh air with a smile. A picnic sounded great right now. I watched Iris unpack her lunch. Sandwich, banana, carrots. Healthy, probably for the best, but it looked tasty nonetheless. I pulled myself out of the pencil bag, helping myself to one of the baby carrots, which at this size was a feast in its own right. I sat on her lap, on top of her skirt of course, hoping it wasn't too intrusive, munching on my carrot and trying to remember whatever I ate last, shoggoth not included... It just wasn't coming to me, so I shrugged.

I looked up at her as she peeled her banana. "So... tell me more about this talent show."

And she did. I listened while she detailed her act, probably looking more than a little surprised when she pulled out my costume.

"Well, hey. That sounds pretty cool. And you're... so prepared." I looked at the tiny suit, frankly a little baffled that she'd thought this far through without a little man to actually fit in it. She could have used a doll, maybe? Either way, I guess my showing up was just what the magician ordered. I laughed. "How can I say no to enthusiasm like this? I'll do whatever you need, Iris. I can be your lovely assistant."

To follow it up, I stood and took a bow which would probably look a little less silly in a suit.

By the time we finished, bells were ringing. I hopped back into the pencil case, letting Iris clean up (I'd really just be a bother trying to help at this size) and giving her a thumbs up when she was ready to go. I wondered exactly what I'd be doing in this magic act. But whatever it was, I figured it couldn't be too difficult. I wouldn't let her down.
111111111111111111111.title: A Nice Picnic Lunch

1111111111111111111111.content:
Now with a full belly of food to complement the butterflies in my stomach, it was time to begin the talent show. Grabbing my costume from my locker, I headed towards the bathroom to get changed. Thankfully, the bathroom was deserted. Hoping Jake wouldn’t be too embarrassed being in a girl’s bathroom, I set him down on the countertop so he could get dressed. I ducked into an empty stall so I could get into costume as well. Shedding my school uniform, I put on my hand-sewn costume. White thighhighs led into a poofy pink skirt and matching sleeveless top, the whole getup peppered with innumerable bows. I tied my long hair into matching pigtails on either side of my head. Stepping out, I saw that Jake had finished putting his costume on as well. The little suit fit him well, and he greeted me with a dramatic bow. “Do you think this costume suits me?” I asked him, and he seemed to like it. It’s rather ornate, but a magical girl needs to stand out, right?

Gathering him up in my hand, I let him ride in one of the many folds among the skirt’s frills. He can surreptitiously stick his head out to watch the show, while still remaining hidden. We made our way to the auditorium, passing several students who gave us strange stares. Oh well, no one said being a magical girl was easy. The audience was already being seated, and I was a bit nervous about performing in front of so many people. It looked like it was going to be a full house. I went behind the stage to get prepared. . It was already filling up with students, milling around and setting up equipment for their unique performances. Stashing my bag with my school uniform away, I retrieved my bag o’ tricks and made sure everything was still there. Let’s see… magic wand… check… handkerchiefs… check… rabbit in a hat… not allowed. The house lights began to dim as the student council president stepped to the microphone and thanked everyone for coming before launching into the list of performers. I swallowed hard when she listed my name, right in the middle of the lineup. Everyone was finished preparing by now, and the first act, a comedy duo, ascended the stage and began their routine. I stood on the side of the stage near the curtain to get a good view. I looked down and smiled at Jake, seeing that he’s laughing along. I hoped he was having a good time. Next was a rock band, then a piano piece, and then my name was announced. Well, this is it. “Ready?” I whispered to Jake.
1111111111111111111111.title: Opening Act

11111111111111111111111.content:
As Iris carried me into the girl's bathroom, I had to admit a little anticipation to see what the big deal was. And I can confirm...that they're just bathrooms. Who really expects anything else? She set me down on the counter with the tiny tux and headed into a stall to change herself. I was a little concerned about someone else coming in and seeing me, but I figured that was no reason not to change. Iris would have considered that, right? I took the chance and changed into the considerably nicer duds for the performance. It fit incredibly well. Hell, it might have fit better than the suits I had at normal size. Go figure.

When she stepped out of the stall, I saw her costume. Something akin to a magical girl, or a sailor scout, with matching twin tails. A bit more magician's assistant than magician, but who was I to question her methods? I smiled and offered her my classiest bow. "You look gorgeous. I think it suits you quite well." Slightly over the top? Sure. But I felt a little like James Bond in this suit, so why not?

I climbed into her hand and then took my place hidden among the frills of her skirt, finding a comfortable place to ride and watch. People were giving her strange looks, but it was the sort of costume that drew attention. I seemed to go unnoticed, which was good. Soon we were backstage, watching other acts as they performed. Pretty good, all things considered. The opening comedy act was funnier than one expected at a school talent show, and the band after actually knew how to play their instruments. And more than three chords. The following piano piece was nice and settled the crowd down after the harder rock music, and then we were up. Iris called down to make sure I was ready, and unable to whisper back audibly, I gave her a nod and a thumbs up from among the ruffles.
11111111111111111111111.title: On With the Show

111111111111111111111111.content:
I leapt onto the stage as my name was called. Murmurs of confusion came from the crowd, probably because few people recognized me. Well, after this show, they’ll all know my face!

Each act was given a few minutes with the curtain down to prepare ourselves. I arranged the tricks upon the table, and soon I heard the anxious chatter among my classmates on the other side of the curtain quiet down as they were hushed by the teachers. I watched a teacher on my side as she counted down the time until the velvet would rise. With each finger she ticked off, my heartbeat increased. I hoped Jake couldn’t tell how nervous I was.

Finally, the curtain rose and I looked across a sea of excited female faces. I recognized several of my classmates, and I hoped I could give them a show that they would talk about forever. An upbeat tempo blared from the speakers, and that was my signal to begin. For my first trick, I tried to turn a bunch of small ribbons into one big cloth, but they caught fire instead! Hmm, maybe I didn’t practice enough, but the next trick is a simple one. Grabbing my wand and wizard hat, I attempted to make a rabbit emerge from the headwear. “Abracadabra!” And… fireworks came out. They illuminated the auditorium with their red and green glow. I began to panic as the teachers scrambled to figure out what was going on. That was not going according to plan. I needed one final trick, something that would blow them all away, otherwise I would be a laughingstock until I graduate.

In desperation, I pulled my trump card out from beneath my frills. I don’t think Jake was expecting this, since I didn’t feel him struggle at all as I placed him onto the table. “I present to you… a tiny man!” The crowd of students gasped as the spotlight shined onto Jake, but it seemed like only the front row could see him well. Jake did a number of action poses as everyone gawped at him. Finally, the music cut out and the curtain lowered. I could hear the applause and cheers of my fellow students as I wiped the sweat from my brow. Jake had certainly saved my bacon, but I hoped he wasn’t too mad at the way I introduced him to the world.
111111111111111111111111.title: Small tricks

choices: Maybe I'm paranoid, but just in case...
1111111111111111111111111.content:
I sat among the frills of Iris's dress, holding tight and waiting while she went about her act. It was going...well, it wasn't going great. Her tricks seemed rather impressive, or at least seemed like they would be if they were if she were declaring what would happen right. I heard her call for a rabbit and them the crackling of sparks as some colorful lights flashed on the stage. I bit my lip. "Come on, Iris... You can do this."

And then came my time to shine, though I wasn't quite expecting it. '...a tiny man!' And suddenly I was out in the open, standing on Iris's palm. A spotlight loomed over me, and I flinched away, nearly blinded by the massive lightbulb. It felt like the sun to my tiny form. But I couldn't let Iris down. I opened by posing with arms wide as any good magician's assistant would. Then I let my arms fall and shifted into more dynamic poses. I wasn't sure how much people actually see of what I was doing, but I hoped it was enough. I felt reasonably impressive, and judging from the oohs and aahs as I moved, they seemed impressed as well.

I ended by doing a cartwheel to one side of her hand, then one the other way, and then one back to the center of her palm, where I bounced on my landing and turned it into a deep bow. Then the applause exploded. I stood back up, staring out into the audience, sweat beading on my forehead as I caught my breath. Judging from the reaction, I'd done enough to bring Iris's act back from the brink. I waved at the audience appreciatively, then I turned to Iris and offered a huge grin. "I think we did it!"

I was ecstatic. Then I thought about something. She had made me 'appear,' but if I didn't redisappear, people might start bothering Iris to see me, and I felt like that could only bring trouble for me, but also for her. I turned back and called up to her, "Make me 'disappear!' However works. Then enjoy your applause. You earned it!"
1111111111111111111111111.title: The Assistant's Perspective

11111111111111111111111111.content:
It felt great to bask in the applause, but I still had to make Jake disappear, or else I would be bombarded with questions that I didn’t have the answers to. Best to keep Jake under wraps for now, if he wound up on Youtube or something I might have creepy scientists try to snatch him away from me. I’m sure he wants to get back to normal and go home eventually, but right now I want him right here with me…

“And now… disappear!” I said, cupping Jake in my hands and bringing them close to my face. With a bit of sleight of hand, I dropped him into my mouth for safe-keeping before bringing my arms over my head and opening my palms in an exaggerated fashion. The crowd went wild as they saw the tiny person disappear right before their eyes! I tried to keep my tongue as still as possible as I quickly took a bow, gathered up my stuff and exited stage left.

By now, I was sure that Jake was sweltering in my mouth. I walked passed a group of girls that was busy preparing their instruments to perform as a rock band.
