choices: Introductions are going pretty well so far.
15211111111111111111.content:
When you poked me, I reflexively flinched, but found it much more tolerable than the last time. You were getting gentler. That was nice. I relaxed noticeably as I realized it, looking up at you.

How I managed to adapt like this, I didn't know. But I wasn't about to argue with whatever was letting me keep my sanity in a decidedly insane situation. The oven dinged to signal reaching its heat and I watched you put the pizza inside before I heard the door open in another room, wincing. Roommates. Oh god. Let's see how this goes.

I turned, expecting someone somewhat similar to Ethan. What I saw was a hulking mountain of a man striding into the kitchen with a certain stiff posture I could only associate with a certain nationality of person. And when he spoke, he confirmed my suspicion. This mountain was Russian.

I stared up as he leaned over me, marveling at a giant among giants as Ethan explained that I was right underneath him. And when he turned to look down at me, I was almost worried. But it seemed Ethan explained his plan to his roommates earlier. Mark here was surprised, but not too confused, it seemed.

He greeted me and I swallowed the lump in my throat and tried not to sound awkward. "Hi, Mark. Yeah, name's Jacob. Jake if you like. Student of nothing now. But still, nice to meet you."

I was tempted to hold out a hand, but at this size, it was a rather pointless notion. Meeting people felt sort of awkward now. Awkward beyond the whole 'them towering hundreds of times my own height above me' part.

Either way, he seemed pretty alright, though I was still a bit nervous being stared at. Now I just had to worry about the other roommate who was apparently on his way.
15211111111111111111.title: Meeting Markov

choices: What's your movie choice, little guy?
152111111111111111111.content:
Mark offered a gentle smile as he looked down at you. At nearly seven feet tall, he stood over just about everyone, albeit at a considerably smaller smaller size difference than between him and yourself. It wasn't hard to tell that you were quite nervous, and understandably so. Still, his eyes held a friendly twinkle, and his smile appeared neither forced nor false.

"It ees good to meet hyou too, Djacob. I hope you will come to enjoy being here with Ethan and us."

I turned back around. "We're making a frozen pizza for lunch. You want any?" Mark considered for a moment, then answered affirmatively. As I went to get two plates and a smaller third for you, the big Russian smiled down at you again and curtly nodded before getting up. He lumbered off to the other bedroom, probably to put away his bag and other things.

"He's a big guy, but he's actually kind of a softie. Like a giant Russian teddy bear." I laughed a little at the imagery. "He does a lot of studying and such, so you might not see too much of him out and about. Jeff's trying to push him to be more social, but it's kind of hard to order someone around when they weigh twice as much as you and can occupy a whole doorway."

Pacing around the counter, I glanced over at the TV. "How about a movie to watch while we eat? Got the whole afternoon and evening off, so we can just lay about for now, kill some time." I pursed my lips, a contemplative expression cast on my face. "Hrm... Maybe something classic or Whedon. Princess Bride's good. Or there's Serenity or the Avengers. What do you think? Or you can make a suggestion. We've got a decent selection here, so if you've got an idea..."

At that moment, the oven beeped again. While you consider your options, I pulled the pizza out and used a cutter to slice it up into eight pieces. Half went on one big plate and half on the other. From one of my slices, I tore off a small end-piece with some pepperoni and set that aside on your little plate. One plate was set on the counter, from where I called Mark to let him know his lunch was ready.

I left you on the countertop for a moment as I set up a tray at the couch in the living room and set our plates down. Then I'm back in front of you. "So... decided on a movie yet?" I reached down to grab you, then stopped. My hand turned up and fingers spread, I place it down on the counter. If you wanted to, you could climb on instead of being grabbed into a fist.
152111111111111111111.title: From Introductions to Lunch

1521111111111111111111.content:
Mark seemed like a pretty nice guy. I wasn't sue what it was, but he seemed to resonate well enough. Similar to you, really. That same weird vibe that kept me from being pissed or scared.

"I think it'll be an alright time, yeah." I answered him.

I zoned a little as you two talked, then snapped out of it when he left and you started talking to me again. watching you pace, I thought about it. Food an a movie. If there were a lewd thought in your head like I'd originally theorized, at least you were jumping the hoops to get there. I chuckled a little.

The Princess Bride. Damned good movie. And I hadn't seen it in quite a while. Anything Whedon was a perfectly fine choice to, though Serenity was a bit rushed in its pacing for my taste.

As for deciding something else, it was the age old problem of "You can have anything. What do you pick?" Plenty of movies popped through my mind. The old Star Wars, some b-horror flicks, but nothing I could be certain was there and you'd like and I could call the top pick.

As I pondered all of this, you were getting the food ready. And when you asked, I had decided exactly nothing. So on a spur of the moment, I picked. "Let's go with the Princess Bride. Been a while since I've seen it, and it never disappoints."

As you set your hand down, I smiled. This was definitely a step up from being grabbed. Somewhat literally, I thought, as I stepped up onto your fingers, coming to rest in the middle of your palm, ready to go.
1521111111111111111111.title: A Movie With Lunch

15211111111111111111111.content:
When you stepped into my hand, my fingers curled carefully and protectively around you. It wasn't a full fist, but it would be something to hold onto and help to keep you in my hand if you tumbled around. You seemed to appreciate it, which was good. I'd figured you might not like always getting grabbed and snatched up like something to just be towed around and shown off as an oddity.

As I carried you over to the couch, I smiled, partly to you and partly to myself. This had been harder than I thought it would be, but it seemed to be going more or less smoothly. At the very least, you were coming to terms and dealing with your new size. I was adjusting, too, learning how to be careful and gentle with everything I did, from the way I held you to how I teasingly poked you very gently to taking this whole thing in slow, careful steps rather than drop you headfirst into something entirely different than what you might be used to.

My hand set down on the tray so you could step off next to or onto your plate, with the little chunk of pizza on it. "Good choice. If you'd bad-mouthed Princess Bride, you'd be out of the apartment before you can say 'Inconceivable'." My tone was entirely joking; I had absolutely no intention to just kick you out or abandon you at your inch-tall size. Regardless of your opinion on arguably one of the greatest movies ever.

While you settled, I put The Princess Bride into the DVD player and let it start up. The widescreen TV brightened to life as the mandatory FBI warnings passed by. It was a decently sized TV, but I imagined that to you, it might have felt like a theater screen, even from back by the couch. I skipped through the previews and menu, and the soft sounds of the retro baseball game filtered in as the movie began.

As the scenes transitioned - the slow introduction of the book by "S. Morgenstern", Westley's departure and presumed death, and Buttercup's engagement to Prince Humperdinck - we ate our pizza in general silence, perforated only by a couple of laughs. 'No more rhymes, I mean it!' 'Anybody want a peanut?' ' GAHH!'

By the time Vizzini died from the iocane powder, we were done eating. I stood, my hand extended so you could climb on again. With the movie paused for a moment, I put the plates aside and slid the tray out of the way to fold up later. Then, sprawling out on the couch, I carefully set you down on my chest again and hit play to let the movie carry on.
15211111111111111111111.title: As You Wish

choices: Might be missing the ending this time around.
152111111111111111111111.content:
As you carried me into the living room, I held one of your fingers to steady myself and keep from tumbling around. It helped a little more than I might care to admit. When you set me down on the tray, I stepped down, trying to position myself next to the plate and finding that there was no comfortable way to manage it and reach my food, I sucked it up and climbed onto the plate itself, sitting next to the pizza.

It was as big as three or four slices would have been to me at normal size and that was fine by me. I broke off a roughly slice-sized piece, looking back at you as you jokingly threatened me. "Hey, if I bad-mouthed the Princess Bride, I'd expect to be thrown out."

I chuckled a little, taking a bite of the pizza. It was a bit tall for my mouth, but I managed well enough, figuring out a good method after two or three bites.

I looked at the TV, whistling a little. It was like a personal movie theatre. Being so small certainly had a few perks. I watched as you set up the movie, then just watched the movie. Despite how long it had been, I remembered a fair portion of the lines, laughing along with the jokes between bites of pizza. Damned fine movie. Damned fine...

Somewhere after making a mistake comparable to getting into a land war with Asia, I noticed my pizza was all but missing and popped the last piece into my mouth. Looking back, I saw you were finished too, and pausing the movie to deal with our plates.

I climbed into your hand again, watching you push things aside and taking my seemingly appointed seat on your chest, leaning back somewhat and getting comfortable as you restarted the movie.

The plot carried on. Swamps filled with rodents of unusual size (which seemed even more ironic to me at this point), death machines, and everything else this fantastic movie had to offer.

But somewhere around the time plans were being laid to storm the castle, I noticed my eyelids start to get heavy. But that was crazy. I never slept during movies. Or during the day, for that matter... It was inconceivable.

But...it had been a long day. And I'd just had quite a bit to eat. AND I was pretty tired on top of that...maybe...maybe just a few minutes. I'll just rest my eyes...

Justification made, I fell asleep on your chest, exhausted, and started to snore lightly after a few minutes, out cold.
152111111111111111111111.title: Enjoying Lunch

choices: Waking up in the evening to a new sight...
1521111111111111111111111.content:
This was nice, this moment. It didn't particularly matter that you were an inch tall, or that I was the one who'd shrunken you. All that mattered was a moment of two guys eating pizza and watching a classic movie. The powerful orchestrated soundtrack held aloft each moment, from Wesley's reunion with his dearly beloved to the terrors of the Fire Swamp to the comical reunion of Fezzik and Inigo.

With the general excitement of this morning out of the way, things were settling down, and you seemed to be adjusting rather well. You'd taken to sitting on the plate rather easily, and you'd grown very used to being held and carried - especially with the newer, more voluntary version I'd started using. And you'd grown just as comfortable with being placed on my chest, the soft rise and fall a rhythmic motion beneath you and the pleasant body heat radiating up towards you. There was still a notable amount of uncertainty, hesitation, and occasional fear, but that was perfectly understandable. You were only an inch tall, after all, and it would be crazy to expect you to be totally comfortable within only a few hours of your sudden downsizing.

Still, I thought as I glanced down at you during the Miracle Max scene, this was going quite nicely. Once I'd explained my good intentions - admittedly carried out with less than noble means - you came around to the concept pretty well. The shower had been a little awkward, more for you than for me, but that would slowly change over time. I could hardly begrudge you for your discomfort when I towered over you naked in a shower stall, sporting a flaccid length several times bigger than you. And you did seem like you were interested in at least trying to get used to it. Everything afterwards, up to this moment, had gone fairly well, and I couldn't help but feel a little satisfied.

At some point during the siege on Humperdinck's castle, I noticed you'd fallen asleep. You lay there on my shirt, lightly snoring as you dozed on. Well, it has been a rather long and exciting day so far, I mused to myself. Maybe a nap's a good idea...

I considered just napping here on the couch. I wouldn't need to move you, and I'm already stretched out. But Jeff could come back at any moment, and I'd prefer the both of us to be conscious the first time he sees you. So, carefully and slowly, I very delicately slip you onto my hand. My steps to my bedroom - our bedroom now, I think - are just as slow and methodical, paced to keep from waking you from your peaceful sleep.

I locked my bedroom door again and set you down for a moment, enough time to pull off my shirt and pants. The boxers I left on for now; I'd avoid my typical naked sleeping until you were a little more comfortable around me. Picking you up again, I climbed onto the bed and sprawled out on my back. Down you went onto my bare chest, where you'd be safe - I was a generally stationary sleeper.

Within a few moments, I joined you in sleep, dozing off in the last days of summer's oppressive heat. My mind wandered, traipsing across dreams and imagination to distant lands. Rather unfortunately, a familiar wet dream of one of my professors resurfaced. When you awoke, it'd be on my bare chest, myself still asleep and the front of my boxers lightly tented.
1521111111111111111111111.title: A Nap Sounds Good...

choices: Are you a restless sleeper? Or out like a log?
15211111111111111111111111.content:
When I fell asleep, I fell asleep hard. I was more tired that I thought, or at least than I cared to admit in the middle of the day. It was such a deep sleep I didn't even dream. Or at least wouldn't remember if I had when I woke up. I didn't notice or react at all when I was scooped up and carried to your room. I was a fairly agreeable passenger. I didn't wake when you undressed, when you lay down, or when I was set on your now bare chest.

A while later, when I finally woke up, I came to a few realizations. The first, we were no longer in the living room. Looking around dazedly, I realized we were back in your room. The next, there was no longer a shirt underneath me. Looking down, I found that I was now lying on your bare chest. At first, this was a little alarming, but I quickly adjusted. It was warmer, fairly soft. Not so bad, really.

The final revelation came a little later as I sat up, decidedly staying awake at least for now. I looked forward, and found that you weren't wearing pants either. And you were clearly having a pleasant dream. I looked at the bulge in your boxers. It was like a giant tent at this size, though not one I was going to explore the inside of any time soon.

Looking up toward your face, I saw you were still sound asleep. Hadn't even thought about explaining staring at your crotch if you'd been awake. I was glad you hadn't been awake for that. Turning back around, I laid down where I was before, staring at the ceiling.

Unless you were the sort of person to roll in your sleep, which was unlikely considering I was still here and who knows when we came back to the room, or if you were the sort to let your hands wander in your sleep, say to somewhere that was begging attention right now, I didn't see any threat.

Not that they were really likely scenarios or that you were very threatening, but at this size, every threat had to be evaluated. I was learning that one way or another.

I sighed contently, crossing my arms behind my head and letting my guard down cautiously.
15211111111111111111111111.title: Nap Time

choices: What's your reaction to this whole thing?
152111111111111111111111111.content:
I'd been out for some time when you awoke. My arms were limply resting on my stomach, between you and the tent at my lap. The mass inside hadn't escaped the boxers, but there was a definite smell of arousal from my pleasant dreaming. A soft smile had spread across my face, though I was still sleeping quite soundly.

Eventually, though, I did wake up, not too long after you'd settled back down. My body shifted a little, the plain of flesh and hair moving underneath you where you were relaxing. Half-awake, my foggy mind directed itself to the most obvious thing, and one of my hands slipped downwards. There it cupped over the bulging mass and squeezed, pulling the fabric tighter - which only served to make the skin-tight underwear define every part of the erection within, a damp spot forming at the tip of the lengthy bulge. From around and under you, a deep, grumbling moan of satisfaction echoes and thunders, my lust-filled mind distracted to anything else.

My heavy-lidded eyes fluttered down, and then I saw you.

In an instant, it all came back to me. My hand flew off my crotch, and my face burned bright red in the first true blush I'd had. To be casually naked around someone was one thing; to start pleasuring yourself in front of them was a very different and much more personal thing. My gaze flicked around; I couldn't decide where to look, but I was having a hard time glancing at either you or the straining tent in my boxers.

Trying to recover from this incredibly awkward situation, I began to focus on the most ugly and unpleasant things I could imagine, my breath slowing to a calm rhythm. Grandmas in underwear. My eyes flicked down to you. Long toenails. What were you thinking, I wondered? Splinters in sensitive areas. Were you mad, or bothered, or something even worse? Miley Cyrus VMA performance. It was hard to tell what you were feeling.

"I, uh..." I stammered, then coughed and cleared my throat. "I'm sorry about that. I was kind of half-awake and just... yeah..." God, I was so embarrassed I couldn't even finish my sentence. This simple action could have wrecked all the friendliness and careful consideration and adapting I'd done up to now, and I hadn't even meant to do it.

"I'm really, really sorry. I promise I wouldn't have done that if I'd remembered you were there..." Not that that really said anything, but I was far too flustered to come up with anything reasonably better.
152111111111111111111111111.title: Like a Log

choices: "I might have done the same thing in your position."
1521111111111111111111111111.content:
Laying there, I was zoning out and ignoring pretty much everything before I felt you start to wake up. I opened an eye, looking up and watching your head only to see you weren't quite awake yet. Wait, where was your hand going?

I followed your moving hand with my eyes, realizing all too late exactly what you were doing as you grabbed yourself and began to massage. "Um...Ethan...?"

For a few moments, I couldn't look away, morbidly curious about what I was seeing. But finally, I managed to turn around, flushing red and trying not to think about what was going on behind me, looking up toward your face as you moaned, feeling it echo through your chest below me. "Yo, Ethan! Not the time for this, man."

I didn't think my miniscule voice was going to wake you up. And it really seemed like it wasn't going to. But then your eyes fell on me, clearly still half-asleep, and you seemed to realize exactly what you were doing, jerking your hand away for lack of a better term and blushing a deeper red than I think even I'd blushed today. It was weird to see you embarrassed after how confident about everything you'd been today, but this was definitely a bit different.

Your eyes darted every which way, suddenly horribly interested in everything in the room that wasn't on your chest or a bit further down. Finally, you spoke up, stumbling over excuses. It was almost a little funny to watch, despite the situation.

"It...it's cool. I understand." God knows he wasn't the first guy in the world to wake up and tend to the old flagpole. And I wasn't exactly the easiest guy in the world to notice right now. "I'm sure it wasn't on purpose or anything. Honest mistake."

I gave a slightly nervous smile, glad you came around when you did, but trying to be reassuring that it was alright. Accidents happen, and all that.
1521111111111111111111111111.title: That's One Way to Wake Up

15211111111111111111111111111.content:
Well, at least you were handling it well. As embarassing as this might have been, you were taking it in stride, so I should, too. I awkwardly meet your gaze and give a slight smile. "I, uh... alright. Still sorry, though." This was going surprisingly well for a scenario where I'd started rubbing one out while an inch-tall guy sat on my bare chest...

Luckily, I'd "settled down", so I wasn't feeling quite as awkward anymore. I carefully sat up, helping you slide off onto the mattress before I stood all the way up out of bed. I pulled my pants and my shirt back on, and I tugged on my sleeves for a moment before leaning forward to let you step into the palm of my hand. A quick glance at the clock showed it was only 4:30. "Hrm, still some time before dinner. I could get my homework out of the way now, or we could go see if Jeff's in, yet." I take a moment to give a long yawn and rub my eyes sleepily with my free hand.

A voice, tinged with a Californian accent, shouted from elsewhere in the dorm, carrying through the closed door. "Yo, Ethan, get your lazy ass out of bed!" I chuckled and pointed towards the door. "Well, that answers that. Guess it's time for you two to meet then." Carrying you in my hand, I moved to leave the bedroom.

Out in the main room, Markov was busy on the couch with a full spread of books, papers, and graphs on the coffee table. He was muttering to himself in a bastardized mix of English and Russian, and he gave a half-acknowledging, half-dismissive wave to the two of us as we came in. Over in the kitchen stood Jeff. He was just short of six feet, with shaggy black hair, and his skin was quite tanned.He was wearing a pair of khakis and a sleeveless tee, so it was easy to see that he had a muscular build and clearly kept in good shape.

"So this is Jake, I'm guessing?" He looked down at you in my hand and gave a short wave with the hand that wasn't holding a beer bottle. "Little smaller than I expected. But where's my manners? I'm Jeff, and it's good to meet ya, Jake. Welcome to the dorm."
15211111111111111111111111111.title: Moving Right Along

152111111111111111111111111111.content:
Today had been a hell of a day, and it wasn't exactly showing signs of slowing down just yet... Still, if I'm being honest, at this point what happened just now was just another leg on this bizarre adventure. It was taking some effort, but I could roll with it and move on. "Apology accepted." I offered with a shrug and similarly slight smile.

While you sat up slowly, I worked my way off the side of your chest and down onto the bed itself, using your hand for help as you held it out and making it to the mattress with only a little difficulty. I watched you stand and dress yourself for a moment before turning away, figuring that might be a little weird...yeah, after all this, that was what was weird. Clearly. I chuckled to myself as you offered a hand and I climbed aboard. When you spoke, I looked up, open for either suggestion. I'd have to meet everyone eventually anyway, but I wasn't opposed to just chilling while you got some work done. But before I voiced this opinion, a surfer-y sort of voice that decidedly couldn't be Mark called for Ethan. That must be Jeff.

"Guess so. Sounds like a fun enough guy." I steadied myself in your hand as you walked, making sure I was good before relaxing a bit. When Markov waved, I waved back instinctively, though he seemed too focused on his work to really notice. All the same, I didn't really want to distract him if that were even possible. He didn't seem the type to take well to that.

Then we were in the kitchen, and before me stood Jeff. His image matched his voice pretty much perfectly. I'd bet on blonde, but otherwise the picture in my head was pretty spot-on. And the beer in his hand told me he was probably a bit more of a partier than Mark over there. When he waved, I waved back, offering a smile. "Nice to meet you too... Glad to see everyone here's pretty friendly. Not that I guess I expected otherwise, but hey."

And I was honestly really glad they apparently knew about this idea, and my... stature beforehand. Would've sucked to have to explain it to both of them. Instead, if was just 'oh, tiny dude. Cool.' and everyone was just sort of cool with it. Not that I was completely adjusted to the concept of being so small myself, but I didn't have it in me right now to sit through an explanation several more times.
152111111111111111111111111111.title: Meeting Jeff

1521111111111111111111111111111.content:
Jeff shrugged. "Well, this whole situation's pretty crazy, yeah, but sometimes you just gotta go with the flow. We don't mind having another roommate, and it's an interesting experience, you can't deny that." The bottle clinked as he drummed his fingernails against it. "'Sides, I bunked with a Texan gun nut in freshman year. Now THAT guy had a lot of crazy stories. Like this one time, he took a remote control car and a homemade flamethrower and-"

"I thought we agreed you weren't going to tell that story again," I cut in, rolling my eyes as I stood there with you in hand. I let you step off onto the counter besides us, giving you a bit more height in the conversation. "Jeff's a physical therapy major and in early training for the armed forces, so he's often out and about or doing something with exercise or stretching." it was quite clear that he worked out a lot; the tight shirt he was wearing defined the bulk of his musculature, and his hairy arms and legs were thick. Though he wasn't as tall as Markov, he could have easily passed for a light bodybuilder.

"It's not easy to look this good," Jeff jokes, playfully flexing his arm and torso muscles. "Just wish I could get either of you two to do some workouts with me. Markov's naturally built like a bear, and you get worn out just running around for a bit. And now you bring another guy in, and I don't think this one's about to use gym equipment any time soon." He took another drink from his bottle and gave a rather dramatic sigh. "What am I gonna do with you guys?"

Then, snapping his fingers, he looked to me. "Oh, uh, by the way, Ethan, I was gonna hit the sauna before it closes and destress. I figured you'd probably say no, but I'll ask anyways."

I shook my head. "Thanks, but no thanks. I've got some work to do, and I want to stick around the apartment for the most part this weekend. You know, help Jake get settled and everything." I smiled down at you. You were handling things pretty well, but I still wanted to be around to help with adjusting.

"Well, maybe he wants to come, then. There's not a lot people at the gym on Fridays, and the sauna's steamy enough that anyone else in there wouldn't notice him if he stayed close." Now he looked down at you on the counter, a friendly smile on his face. "How about it? I bet you could do with a bit of destressing after all this weirdness, right?"

I stood on the sidelines and waited for your response. Inch tall or not, you were still a person, so I left this choice to you. Did you want to hang around the apartment or get out for a bit?
1521111111111111111111111111111.title: Jeff the Jock, sort of...

15211111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was a little disappointed that Jeff's story was cut off. I wanted to hear exactly what the insane Texan did with his r/c car and flamethrower, but I guess there might have been some legal implications to knowing. Not that I was going to be questioned about anything at this size, even if there was any way to know I knew anything about any alleged flamethrowing... I need to stop rambling thoughts like that.

When you lowered your hand to the counter, I happily stepped off, nodding along as you told me about Jeff. Sounded like he was the closest thing to a jock your apartment had. Not that that was saying much with the ever-studious Markov, and you who seemed to have...smaller interests. I chuckled as he flexed, then as he described his predicament with you two. "I don't know. I think I could bench a solid... ounce? Maybe two?"

Honestly, even that light a weight would probably still be too much for me at this size, but it sounded good and I didn't expect to be called out on it, so damn the consequences.

When I heard Jeff mention a sauna, I perked up a little, though it probably not noticeable with my stature. I'd been in a sauna a few times, during my occasional weeks of "Let's start going to the gym, it'll be great!" Inevitably, those plans would fall apart due to workloads or time or laziness, but my favorite part when I was going was probably sitting in the sauna and just letting the heat wash over me after a couple hours of lifting things, sweating out all the stress and effort of the day.

When the choice came down to me on what to do, I looked at Jeff, then at you. "Actually...if it's okay, I wouldn't mind hitting a sauna. It is really relaxing, after all..."

I offered a smile as I asked. I didn't want to completely blow off your wanting to help me get comfortable here, but at the same time a sauna sounded really great right now. And I could use a little something to help me relax, even as calm as things were right now.
15211111111111111111111111111111.title: Sweating the Small Stuff

choices: Hopefully the ride's not too bad.
152111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I smile back at you and nod. "Go right ahead, then. I certainly don't mind, and if it's something you enjoy and find relaxing, all the better." I scratch the back of my head and add, "Besides, there's the whole weekend ahead yet, so we've got plenty of time for other stuff later." Were you paying attention, you might notice the briefest glint of nervousness flash across my expression before I look up at Jeff. "Just remember to be careful and keep him close. You know, make sure no one sees him or anything." Geez, I sounded like a worried mother on the first day of school. Not that I didn't have reason to worry, of course...

Jeff nods and goes to rinse out his bottle. "Yeah,yeah. I'll keep an eye out for him or whatever. Go ahead and do your homework or something." I nod and give you a short wave. Then I'm off, back to my room, and you're left with Jeff.He sets his empty bottle down by the sink and smiles at you. "Alright, then." He reaches down and picks you up of the countertop, pinching you around the waist between two thick fingertips. His grip is a little rough, but it's only his first time handling someone so small.

He raises you to face level and smiles down at you. His tight hold loosens a little as you're suspended in the air before a billboard-sized face. Jeff, like myself, takes a moment to just feel the sensation of holding someone. Your warm little body between his fingers, so tiny and alive, feels oddly pleasant to the touch. "Alright, Jake. I don't really have any shirt pockets, so you're gonna have to go into my shorts pocket for the trip there and back. He looks at your tiny face and waits for a sign of approval. When you give it, he lowers you down and carefully deposits you into one of his cavernous khaki pockets. There's a decent amount of light from the opening far above, and the fabric isn't too uncomfortable. There's a considerable amount of heat from his leg, just on the other side of one of the fabric walls.

The pocket compresses sideways as Jeff lightly pats his hand over it. "And off we go..." As he starts to walk, his leg falls into a sort of rhythm, rocking back and forth. It's not the most perfect carrying method, but it could be far, far worse.
152111111111111111111111111111111.title: Jeff's Ready to Go

1521111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"See you later." I wave as you walk off to do your own thing, then turn back to the smiling Jeff.

Before I've readied myself for any sort of movement, he's scooped me up and I flail a bit in his over-strong grasp. I start to think this might not have been the best idea, but he adjusts his grip fairly quickly and it becomes more bearable. I just have to give him some time, account for the learning curve. Handling someone my size wasn't exactly something you had instincts for after all.

When he told me where I'd be riding, I was a little disheartened. I hadn't really thought about transportation, and I wasn't overly crazy about riding in a pants pocket. But I didn't have much say in the matter now and it was something I should probably get used to. I steeled myself and offered a nod of approval. "Alright. Ready to go when you are."

And Jeff deposited me in his pocket. I slipped into the dark fabric cave, stopping abruptly but not painfully at the bottom and adjusting to my surroundings. It was dark, warm and enclosed. Because of just how small I was, I had plenty of room to move, but the pocket was still fairly flat between the stiff outer leg of the shorts and Jeff's own leg. Speaking of his leg, I could feel the heat wafting off of him through the thin fabric of the pocket. Add a little steam and this could be a functional sauna on its own. Okay, maybe not that bad, but make no mistake. It was hot.

Jeff gave the pocket a pat, pressing me into his leg with each contact, and then we were off. I never really considered how much a pocket might swing inside someone's shorts while they walked. I'd typically always worn long pants that didn't move as much. But shorts hung looser and allowed more movement. The pocket swayed forward and back, left and right, knocking me against Jeff's leg with every other step. It wasn't an unbearable rocking, but it did make getting comfortable difficult.

Still, we'd be there soon, right? How far could it be?
1521111111111111111111111111111111.title: I've Had Worse

15211111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Fortunately for you, the on-campus gym isn't very far. Jeff's pace is at least consistent; the back-and-forth bumping becomes almost rhythmic, like a sit in a really, really big rocking chair. Even the simplest motions can become like amusement park rides at your new size...

The loud woosh of a door and the familiar chill of air conditioning are the clues you'd need to figure out the walk's just about over. Jeff's voice is muffled from above, but you might just be able to hear little bits of the conversations he has with the person at the front desk, and with a coach down the hallway to the locker room. For a brief moment, it feels like the pocket is collapsing in, but it ends up just being Jeff resting a hand over you, probably checking to see if you're doing okay.

Finally, after what feels like a year, the guy's enormous fingers slide in overhead, darkening your little space. His grip is still a bit rough, but not painfully so at least. The sudden shift to light may be harsh on your eyes at first, but soon enough you can adjust enough to see the seemingly cavernous locker room around you. Jeff's picked a spot between rows of lockers, where the last of the lingering gym rats are unlikely to find you both. Above, the giant face gives you an encouraging smile, and you're placed down on the warm, plastic-coated bench.

You have a minute or two to consider your surroundings as Jeff sorts his belongings into a free locker. It's not a particularly exciting room - a usual mixture of soft blues and light greys and whites - but the imagination can wander to the thought of dozens of giants crowded in here, each the size of a small building. Muscles bigger than your body, especially with the usual gym-going crowds of jocks and bodybuilders. The lingering odors of sweat and testosterone are heavy even now, especially to your size-refined senses.

A shifting of fabric draws your attention back to Jeff, who had just taken off his shirt. He'd said before he liked to exercise regularly, but now it's very clear he's in great shape, with really well-built abs and strong pecs that'd put most folks to shame. The dude must be a bit vain, too; he's got no hair on his chest, the only hair is a little bit of a treasure trail, barely more than a hint of short brown hair, above his waistband. The jock sighs and stretches out, his muscle flexing in a way that would make just about anyone watching envious, or more.

He glances down at you and looks a bit surprised. "You're not getting ready? I don't think you'll want to take your clothes into the hotbox - it's a Finnish sauna, so it's very hot and I'm guessing you'd rather not have your pants steamed onto you." His smile curls on one side, a playful and harmless jest as he suggests, well...
15211111111111111111111111111111111.title: Short Ride, in for the Long Haul

153.content:
On a late summer day, shortly before 10 AM, a seemingly normal blue car drove by a seemingly normal California beach-side house and dropped off a seemingly normal package. All of it, from the Goodyear tires to the half-tattered shoes the driver wore to the cardboard build of the box, perforated by a few holes in the top, seemed perfectly normal to any passerby. In point of fact, however, none of it was.

That was not to say that the premise in and of itself was an oddity. Goodyear tires were as popular as ever in California, in the sense that air and free glasses of water at family restaurants were popular. Everybody used them, but nobody really thought too much about it. Shoes, worn by years of wear, had been popular since the invention of the shoe. After all, any working-class person might say, what's the point of a shoe if you throw it away when it gets just a little worn down? Preposterous, they'd say with a scoff as they drank their free glass of water. And boxes made of cardboard often ended up on doorsteps, left there by postal workers and delivery trucks and freight industries. Uncountable boxes had been left on uncountable doorsteps for so long that it seemed absolutely normal, even if the receiver was, in fact, not expecting to get anything at all.

The things that were not normal were the elements of this particular event.

The car, an old model with faded blue coat and rust slowly claiming victory, was not an average car. This particular vehicle had been used in no less than two bank heists and three hit-and-runs and had been restored and recolored several times to be generally inconspicuous. Cars, this one's driver believed, were things to be appreciated for a while, much like a free glass of water and unexpected deliveries.

The driver himself was no less average. Like his vehicle, he had been through a lot of crime, mostly at the hands of the drug runners to which he found himself amiably connected. His appearance was generally professional: salt and pepper hair, dress pants and a white shirt, collar loosened. He carried an air of someone who had things to do and would rather not deal with anyone along the way to those things.

As both car and driver moved on, the last abnormal element remained at the doorstep of the California beach-side house, the box that was delivered. It seemed normal: it was rectangular, brown, and it stayed motionless as it sat there, taped very lightly and poked with holes on top. What were truly abnormal were the contents: an unconscious adult man, normal in just about every aspect except for the fact that he was only two inches tall and completely naked.

As for the house itself, it wasn't a mansion, but it certainly wasn't a dump either. Located just by the beach, the three-story building was a combination of wood and stone design, with a back porch that extended into a little dock where a speedboat was bobbing up and down on the day's gentle rocking waves. A garage adorned the side of the house, with garage doors on both the front and back sides. The front was open, and anyone walking by would see the two trucks and the pair of jetskis inside. Parked at the front of the house was a third vehicle, a red pickup with clean chrome and a tribal tattoo design of a hawk painted across the hood.

The inconspicuous delivery with its remarkable contents sat at the door for an hour or two before the people who lived in the house emerged. The first was a guy, looking in his late twenties, with shoulder-length blonde hair. He was dressed rather casually, in a pair of colorful striped boxers, a sleeveless white T-shirt, and yellow-tinted sunglasses. With the air of someone who had mastered a hangover, he hobbled to the mailbox, waving casually at a few of the neighbors and taking more than a moment to admire the fine curves of a passing jogger. He muttered to himself as he wandered back, giving the box only a cursory glance as he flipped through the flyers and magazines and coupons and such that came in the daily bundle and headed back inside.

The second, only minutes later, was another man, this one somewhere around the age of the first. His hair was neat black, short and with hints of spiky rebellion. He might have been younger, but the neat dress pants and shirt, diamond-patterned vest, and dark blue tie implied an air of more maturity and superiority. He shouted something incomprehensible back into the house before closing the front door. In his hurry, he didn't even notice the box; he briskly made his way to the pickup and was gone into the distance as quickly as he'd exited the building.

The third, who stepped out to wave goodbye to the second, was a girl. If one were to guess, they might have pegged her around 24 or 25. Like the first, her hair was a vibrant blonde, but streaked with soft hints of a faded purple; her eyes were a soft green-blue that complimented the cool ensemble of her skimpy shirt and ripped denim shorts. As she bent down to look at the box curiously, a passerby might have noticed the pattern of scars on her left calf, healed over from whatever wound long ago but still distinct on her slightly tanned skin.

"No writing or anything," she thoughtfully murmured to herself as she picked up the package. In her hands, it felt almost empty, but there was definitely something inside. The girl took it inside to the kitchen counter, where a pair of scissors made quick work of the tape binding. When she looked inside, she nearly jumped.

Curiously, she peeked back in, realizing that it was not in fact a dead rat, but a living, breathing, tiny person. Cautiously, as if she expected him to leap up and bite her, she leaned closer, wondering just who this guy was and how he'd come to wind up on their doorstep smaller than a doll. He was slowly coming to, and so she watched as he awoke inside the box.
153.title: Seemingly Normal

1531.content:
I sat up, groaning. The world seemed off, somehow. Dark on all sides, with some light coming in from above me. Where the hell was I? Some basement room somewhere? Just one light and no windows?

How the hell did I get somewhere like this? And where exactly was it?

I cursed a little as I rubbed my temples, then my eyes, then finally opened them up and saw where I was. It was a brown room. Brown...everything. Solid brown walls with no decoration whatsoever. Solid brown floor with a...seam running down the middle. Solid brown ceili-

As I looked up, I slammed myself back against the floor, freezing in terror. Where there should have been a seemingly normal ordinary brown ceiling, instead there was a hole, wall to wall up into god knows where. And watching me from within (or without) that hole was a giant girl. Blonde. Seemingly more curious than anything, although she looked almost scared. Like I was going to hurt her somehow. I wasn't sure how to react at first, just staring from my position laying on the floor of the room. Or maybe...it was a giant box?

My head hurt, and I was having trouble considering it, but the words I was thinking seemed to form out of my mouth as I looked at this girl.

"...who are you? How did I get here?"
1531.title: A Seemingly Normal Headache

15311.content:
She was every bit as startled as you, her eyes wide and mouth open in surprise and uncertainty. It wasn't every day one found a package with a two-inch-tall person inside on their front porch. As you spoke, she continued to stare, almost impossibly still like a deer in headlights.

Then, with a blink, she snapped out of it. A thoughtful expression crossed her face as he looked around, leaning back a little to see further around the corners of the rooms around her. Some elaborate prank? An illusion cast by cameras or mirrors or something? No. No that would be just ridiculous. Then again, she thought to herself, there was a tiny man in a box on the kitchen counter. It was hard not to consider how.

Running her fingers through her hair, she looked back down at you. "I, uh... I'm Lisa." Yes, that was it. Focus on something normal. Something that made sense. "For how you got here..." As she tried to think of what to say, an idle thought tickled her subconscious. Seconds later, it sprang to the surface of her mind. She jumped slightly, as if shocked by static electricity. "Wait a sec, wait a sec. I-I remember, something like this going on. On the news, or the 'net, or..." She drifted off again. "Maybe the paper," she eventually said, more to herself than to you.

Lisa walked out of sight, then paused, a thought crossing her mind. She returned and leaned over to peer into the box. "I'm, uh... I'm gonna tilt the box onto its side so you can walk out, 'kay?" Her shoulders visibly shifted, and then slowly the box started to tip over. As it turned, she kept her eyes on you all the while, a concerned expression on her face all the while. Very carefully, she let it settle, and then she was off to the other side of the kitchen, where an old pile of newspapers was stacked on a rolling end table. She muttered to herself, vague murmurs that even you would have had trouble hearing, as she flipped through the pile.

After a minute or two, she victoriously yanked a sheet out and held it up to you with a smile. She was still visibly freaked out, but she was going to try and stay calm and positive if it killed her. Walking back over, she laid the paper out next to you and jabbed a finger at the walls of text.

"Here. Uh, people showing up in boxes and alleys around the country only an inch or two tall. 'S'been all over the news for, like, a month, I think. Nobody's really sure what happened. Everybody's got a theory, o'course. Black ops stuff, mafia, aliens, poisons in the water. Some people were handed over to the feds, a couple were taken by people claiming to be government agents, and I think there was a story about a man who found his original family after a bunch of Missing Ads and stuff."

The girl ran her fingers through the blonde and purple mass of her hair again. "The people who are shrunk can't even explain what happened, since they don't remember anything. Not even before they were shrunk. Kinda like, uh, what's the term?" She snapped her fingers as it came to her. "Amnesia." She looked down at you again, her sea-green eyes intense as she looked at you. "Do, uh, do you remember anything? A name, anything?
15311.title: Quick on the Draw

153111.content:
She introduced herself as Lisa, and I noticed she was just as freaked out as I was. As she struggled to remember anything about my situation, I listened intently,. and as she tilted the box, I hurried to the edge, supporting myself to turn as the box did, now walking on what I'd considered a wall just moments ago.

I stepped out onto the table, watching Lisa hurry over to root through some papers. As she did, I got a better look at her. She seemed pretty, and from here, I could see her body matched. A nice figure, though one I tried not to stare at. No worse way to introduce yourself than staring at a girl's butt just because she'd turned around.

I waited a little impatiently, and got excited when she found what she was looking for. I looked at the article in her hands as she explained what had been going on. Or at least, what people had been saying was going on. Someone or something was distributing these boxes of people, at least. I could attest to that with first-hand experience.

As she explained the amnesia, I nodded. That would certainly explain a lot. Not terribly convenient, but it did explain.

"I do...I remember my name. It's Jake. Or I'm Jake, rather." I looked up at her. "Nice to meet you, by the way, Lisa, strange as this may be..."

I was still freaking out inside, but I could at least be nice. She seemed pretty helpful so far, and I didn't feel like I was in any immediate danger.

"Other than that...not much. Woke up in that box confused and absolutely tiny with no other memories to speak of..."

I sighed. It was frustrating. If I could at least remember what did this, I could try to come up with some solution, or find someone who could. But as it was...I had Lisa. A nice, pretty girl, but one who knew as much as I did about all this.

"So...what happens now? I don't want to be a burden, but...I don't really have anywhere to go. Nor any means to. Don't think I'd make it out of your driveway if I even got outside."
153111.title: The Man With a Name and Nothing Else

1531111.content:
As you spoke, Lisa leaned a little closer, a thoughtful expression plastered across her face. She chewed absentmindedly on her thumb as she listened to you, most likely a nervous habit. All the symptoms were the same, so this was probably done by whoever, or whatever, had done this to the other victims. Now, as you posed it, the tricky question was what to do.

She began to pace by the counter. Step, step, step, turn, step, step, step, turn... "So, uh... I guess there's a few options. We call in the police, or the FBI or CIA or whatever, I dunno... They probably know more about what's going on than anyone else. Of course, nobody's really heard about them having any success, and you'd be in the feds' hands." She winced slightly at how literal that was. "No pun intended, sorry..."

"We could put out an ad or something. I mean, it's a one in a million shot at best, but you could get lucky." Again, her hand went through her hair. "It'd have to be a bit subtle, so e don't draw attention, but it'd also have to be spread enough to get the attention of... well, whoever knew you." She bit her lips and muttered, more to herself than you, "Jesus, listen to me. I've barely been up an hour and I'm talking about spy game shit..."

She frowned and stopped pacing, trying to think. Her idle fingers strummed against the granite counter. "The only other option I can think of is you staying here, at least a day or two until we can get this figured out." The look on her face suggested that she wasn't so certain that was possible. "You wouldn't need much space to sleep, and food's not a problem. But I guess you'd probably need one of us around for help getting around and stuff..." Her words might have seemed like she was talking about a pet, but she was doing what she could with the situation as it was.

"It's, uh, all your choice, 'course. I mean, you're still a person and all." She turned to look down at you, and her eyes lit up. It was as if she'd realized just how little you were wearing. That was to say, nothing at all. Her face flushing a little, she glanced around, then grabbed a soft red rag. From it, she tore a tiny piece, big enough to be a blanket at your size. The rag she set aside, and the little scrap she offered to you. "You might want to, uh, cover up," she said, her eyes flickering down to motion to your bare body. "So what's your call, Jake? The cops, the ad, or here?"
1531111.title: Plenty of Thoughts

15311111.content:
I listened to her suggestions as she paced, realizing a few steps in that I'd begun pacing myself as I thought about each option.

The Feds? I...I didn't like that idea. Maybe it was one too many sci-fi movies, maybe it was their history of secret science experiments, or maybe it was just the general secrecy of all those organizations. But something about it made that sound like a very bad plan. I'd more than likely end up dissected, or experimented on, or god knows what else...

An ad? Not a terrible idea? I couldn't really remember who it was who might be looking for me, or where they might be. Hell, I could be on the other side of the country from them now. Who knows how far these box-wielding psychos when when they delivered their packages? And she was right. We'd have to be stealthy. Missing Persons posters? Not so stealthy. We didn't have the means to get the word out and control the audience. Could end badly, and might loop back to that first option in the end.

Staying here...well, Lisa certainly seemed nice enough. Accommodating, wasn't trying to do weird science to me. Roommates might be weird, but I hadn't met them, so I had no room to judge. If nothing else, it was a good place to crash while we considered the other options and tried to come up with a more solid plan.

Covering up...wait, what? I looked at her as she suggested it, then looked down, suddenly all too aware of the fact that my clothes apparently hadn't shrunk with me. I took the rag, swiftly tying it around my waist like a towel. "Sorry about that..."

I took a deep breath, trying to recover my modesty and looked at her. "I think...it's best if I stay here. I don't trust the feds, and posters are just as likely to bring attention we don't want as they are to help. If you don't mind, I'd like to take advantage of your courtesy. I wouldn't be much of a hassle. And if you get sick of me, I guess you could always just throw me out." Literally... I laughed a little, but there was a nervous air to it.
15311111.title: The Beginnings of a Plan

153111111.content:
Lisa glanced away, suddenly considering how interesting the view from here down the hall to the living room was as you noticed none of your clothes had shrunk with you. She bit her thumb again and tried not to think about how you were kind of attractive. Thinking too much about such a thing was only going to make this even more awkward than it already was.

Once you mumbled, she took that as a sign it was okay to look your way again. The both of you were still pretty nervous and uncertain about any of this, but at least you seemed to be trusting her a little more. Noting your nervous laugh, she tried to smile a little, wanting to comfort you but not quite sure how to go about it. "I wouldn't think of it. You seem like a pretty nice sort of guy. You're welcome to stay here until we get something figured out." Again, that uncertain expression. She had pretty much no idea what to do. But she'd heard your nervous laugh. As much trouble as she was having with the situation, it paled in comparison to your end of things. You were two inches tall and standing on a stranger's kitchen counter with nothing but a name and a piece of fabric for modesty. You needed help, and right now she was the only one you had that you could turn to.

At that moment, a guy with blonde hair, the one who had brought the mail inside earlier, came down the staircase. Thinking fast, Lisa stepped in front of you and casually leaned against the counter as if she just happened to be standing there. He swayed into the room, dressed now in a pair of ragged, ripped jeans, and a grey tank top that read "Battle of the Boomers, 2006, Indigo Beach, Australia" in cracked, faded maroon text. His eyes were a bit glossed over, but definitively grey.

"Mornin', Leeser. S'goin' alright?" The powerful Australian accent was so thick that if it had been a physical liquid, one might have mistaken it for concrete in the process of setting. As he stepped in, an equally powerful aroma of alcohol accompanied him. Yet, he seemed to contain it and redirect it casually, and it didn't really affect him beyond a mild wobble in his step and the glossy, shot eyes.

"Feeling sober, Bon? Or hitting the coffee pot for a pick-up?"

"Leeser, you can chat it up till we're both nackered, but I'm not gonna touch your nasty bean juice." He held up his arms and slowly enunciated each word. "'Sides, I am... a picture... of sobriety."

"That's good, because, uh, there's someone you need to meet. He's gonna be staying with us for a few days or so, just until he can figure out where he's headed."

"What, he's off a dock without a bloody bed to kick in?"

"As I recall, so were you when you stumbled into that bar back in 2005 to complain about... what was it again? How American beers were 'full of piss and saltwater'?"

He considered that for a moment as he leaned against the fridge. "Alright, I'll give you that one. So where's the bloke, then? Cab out front?"

"Nnnn... not quite. You remember that thing in the news about people turning up only a couple inches tall? They show up in boxes on doorsteps?"

Bon's face visibly paled as he remembered the box he'd passed by outside. "You-you don't mean...?"

Lisa stepped aside, no longer blocking you from sight on the countertop. Bon's eyes went from her to you, then back to her, then you again.

"Oh, I can just tell I'm gonna need a slab of Cooper's to make it through today..."
153111111.title: Meet Bon

choices: "I can definitely understand wanting a drink right now..."
1531111111.content:
I watched Lisa as she seemed to try not to stare at me. Probably partly trying not to think about my formerly naked form. How I didn't realize and try to cover myself before I wasn't sure, but I felt like a bit of an airhead of it.

That was when I saw another guy walk into the room. I got a quick glance at him before Lisa threw herself in front of me, leaning back to hide my presence and suddenly filling my view with her fairly attractive rear. I say fairly attractive because anything more colorful would sound like I'm flirting and that would probably only stress her out more, but then I realize I'm rambling rationalizations for word choice in an inner monologue and just feel foolish, listening to the two talk.

He speaks in a thick Australian accent. One I'd impersonated with friends on a number of occasions. And it sounds like he's had a bit to drink last night. Man after my own heart. God, a bottle of something would last forever at this si- This is not the time to be thinking about this.

Lisa starts to explain I'll be staying with them and he questions it. They banter a bit, and then she points out the box and he seems to go quiet.

"You-you don't mean...?" I hear him say.

Then Lisa steps aside and I make eye contact with the astounded Aussie. Then he was staring at Lisa, then back at me. When he spoke, I wanted to laugh a little, but managed to hold it back, stepping forward as he steadied himself and greeted me.

"G-" I stopped myself before I butchered the accent. Nasty habit to have, picking up accents when you hear them. Tends just to annoy the actual holders. "Hi...Bon, was it? I'm Jake. Nice to meet you..."

The words felt out of place still, and it was evident in my voice that I thought so. Situation straight out of a sci-fi movie and here we were exchanging pleasantries like we'd just met on the street.

I suddenly felt horribly under-dressed and silly looking in my rag-skirt affair. What I wouldn't give for a respectable, but tiny, pair of pants right now.
1531111111.title: G'day

15311111111.content:
Luckily, it seems you weren't alone in your nervousness. The Aussie merely stood there with a blank expression, half-leaning on the fridge, as you introduced yourself. A half-smile was plastered across his face as he tried to keep a semblance of calm. "Yeah... It's nice to meetcha, Jake, as it were." He laughed, the uncertainty and nervousness cracking through. He licked his lips, considering your words. "A drink's probably 'bout due right now. Let's oblige. A bit o' liquid lunch'll make this easier to deal with."

He started to pull the fridge door open, but suddenly, Lisa's arm snapped out and pushed it closed again. There was a quiet and commanding look to her face, almost maternal and very judging. Bon recoiled slightly, mostly from surprise, then returned it with a glare of his own.

"Wot? You gonna stop me from enjoyin' a tinnie what I paid for wif my own money?" His voice was raising slowly and stepping thicker into his homeland accent.

"Calm down." Lisa was trying to remain collected, but her tone was slowly growing louder, too. "It's not good for you to always drink away a problem because you don't want to deal with it. Dr. Tanner said-"

"Not that bleedin' scrubber!" he practically spit out. "Why don't you just fookin' trust me, Leeser?!? I'm not an alko, and I've not gone fookin' mental!"

Lisa reeled back a step or two. The Aussie was seething angry, looking like he might lash out at any moment. Looking somewhat satisfied by his verbal victory, he grabbed two cold cans of beer from the fridge and wandered down the hall and out of sight again.

The blonde stood there, half-frozen. Her gaze was fixated on the fridge, where Bon had been only a moment ago. Slowly, she let out a long, exasperated sigh, like a deflating tire. A hand ran through her hair. Then, as if waking up and remembering where she was, she looked over to you.

"Oh. Uh... I'm sorry about that. I shouldn't have... yeah..."

She slinked over to the counter and slumped into a chair with a tired expression pasted across her face. "I probably worry too much, but he's just-" She caught herself. "Sorry. Not something you want to know about, I guess. Anyways..." She put on a smile as before, although a little more weary. "It's no problem with me if you stay here. Bon won't mind; he's generally friendly and easygoing. Logan... well, he might complain, but he'll say yes to sheltering you a few days. I know Jenny will be okay with it, if she even gets back from out of state by the time we get this sorted out. Chris and Riley are out and about getting ready for a boat trip, but you'll probably meet them when they get back later today... Chris'll jump to say yes, and Riley would follow him off a cliff, so he's on board, too."

Her smile and expression had become a little more reassured and lively. "That's a full group of yes, then. I mean, there's still introductions, of course, but that's easy enough." Lisa leaned forward and down a little, her not-insignificant cleavage barely concealed by the low-cut top, to be a little closer. "So what do you want to do? Board games? Over-the-top action flicks? Brunch?"
15311111111.title: Confrontation

153111111111.content:
As Bon reached for the fridge, I watched Lisa snap in front of him in an attempt to stop him, and I suddenly felt like I'd suggested something I probably shouldn't have.

Before I could say anything, they were arguing. He was right pissed, and she was only looking out from him, but he didn't seem to want to hear any of it. For a moment, I thought he was actually going to hit her, but he seemed to be fine with shouting, taking a few cold ones and walking off triumphant to down them somewhere else.

As Lisa stood there, I frowned. And when she sighed, I felt like deflating along with the sound. She looked back at me and mumbled some sort of apology as she slid into a chair by the table, looking exhausted. I felt awful, and wanted to say something, but I couldn't quite find the right words before she went on.

She started to list her other roommates. It was a full house, it seemed. I was lucky I didn't need much room. But then again, if I were normal sized, I probably wouldn't be in this predicament. They sounded like a fairly colorful crew. I wasn't quite sure how this would go, but if nothing else, it seemed guaranteed to be interesting.

As she leaned onto the table, I walked over to her, greeted by the view down her shirt at her ample bosom. I stared for a moment or two in awe before shaking my head and managing to tear my eyes away, looking up to her face as she asked what I wanted to do.

I shrugged at that question. "Whatever you were up to before this, feel free to keep doing it, and I'll just sort of hang out. I'm not gonna shift your plans around and require entertainment. That wouldn't be very gentlemanly of me."

I took another step closer, putting a hand on her arm.

"And about just now...It was my fault. I didn't know it was a sore subject, or I wouldn't have..." I sighed. "Sorry...don't blame yourself."
153111111111.title: Responsibility

choices: Are you hungry? ... For breakfast, that is.
1531111111111.content:
Lisa noticed your momentary entrancement at her bared cleavage, but she was more amused than anything else. You seemed like a generally nice guy, and it was probably hard to not notice boobs that were bigger than you were. Besides, she mused, she'd gotten a bit of a sight earlier before giving you the rag to cover up.

When you put your little hand on her arm, she looked at you and listened closely. You were genuinely apologetic, believing that the little incident had been your fault. She smiled softly and carefully set her hand across her arm, pinky resting gently on your hand. "You're a real gentleman, Jake. Whatever happened to you, you don't deserve it." When it was time, I quickly sliced the pizza into eighths and put a couple of the slices onto my plate. I moved the plate and you to the kitchen table and carefully set you on the rim of the plate. I sat down with a napkin and tore off a corner of the paper fabric and the very end of one of the slices. These little scraps I handed to you, each one the size of your head. With that taken care of, I started to tuck into my slices. I wasn't too worried about you being seen; if anyone came in the front door, I'd have enough time to hide you before they got to the kitchen.
15411111111111111111111.title: Pizza: The Modern Day Ambrosia

choices: "I can just chill if you do need to do anything."
154111111111111111111111.content:
When you lifted me out of the water, you might have noticed me start shivering. Despite that, your hand was exceedingly warm and slightly awkward as it might have been to be wrapped in it naked, it was really a pretty comfortable place to be. And you seemed to be a little more gentle than earlier on top of that, which made it even better.

Standing on the sink, I was freezing once more, waiting patiently while goosebumps grew on my skin and you found and tore up a bandana for my use. When you finally handed me one of the scraps, I was impressed by its effectiveness. You wouldn't think a bandana would be super great for drying a person off, but it did the job with relative ease and it was didn't hurt to work with. In a couple minutes, I was suitably dry, stepping over to the pile of my clothes and putting them back on piece at a time. They smelled a bit like chlorine still, but there were worse smells, and I didn't really expect to come across a store specializing in clothes my size any time soon. I did my best to make my hair somewhat presentable, though at this size, if it was a bit messy I didn't think anyone was really going to be complaining.

So I got dressed, and when I was ready I called up to you and waited to be picked up and carried away once more. And then we were off to the kitchen, where I could smell pizza ready to come out of the oven. I hopped onto the counter as you let me down, marveling at the size of the debris and hand-held instruments around me. God, I could build a house out of these sugar grains... This was insane. Honestly, just when I think I'm getting used to being so small, something else reinforces just how miniscule I am and makes me feel smaller.

Behind me, I hear you set down the plate, looking back and seeing the enormous pizza stretched out before me, eyes widening and a grin spreading across my face. Maybe this wasn't all so bad...

I sat, waiting for the pizza to cool and looking around some more, marveling at everyday items now the size of vehicles and buildings. It really was a different perspective... I looked at you every now and again, feeling lucky despite everything that had happened. You were a good guy, or at least seemed it so far, who wasn't gonna do anything to hurt me and seemed to respect me despite my height. I could have done a lot worse. I ran into the right giant to make friends with...

Soon, the pizza was ready. I watched you slice it up, then we moved to the table, where I sat next to the plate, taking a scrap of pizza as I was offered it. Even this tiny piece was still taller than my mouth, and it was a bit of a feat to eat it cleanly. I'd have to take a bit of cheese and sauce, then a bite of the crust below it to keep my progress somewhat even. It was slow going, but it was delicious. I had no idea when I'd last eaten, but it might as well have been an eternity for the sudden hunger I ate with.

When I was finished wolfing and had slowed myself down a bit, I looked up at you eating your own pizza and tried to strike up conversation. "So what do you usually do with your free time? I don't want to throw off any plans, or stop you finishing anything you need to get done."
154111111111111111111111.title: Pizza Time

1541111111111111111111111.content:
Dinner went quickly enough. You'd definitely been hungry, if the way you scarfed down your little piece of pizza was any indication. You seemed content enough with the scrap, even though you had to work a little to eat it because of your tiny size. Figuring you had things handled, I turned my attention back to my own food and tucked in. Most of the meal was silence, which was fine by me. Eventually, though, you turned towards me again and spoke up. I finished what I'd been chewing and replied.

"Well, I do have one thing I need to do online. It'll take a while, though, so it'll be really late by the time I'm done with it." I brushed my red hair out of my face and idly tapped my fingers on the tabletop as I thought about it. "It's a gaming livestream, too, so it'll take all my attention. I could probably turn on TV or something if you don't want to watch." I wasn't sure how much you liked games or let's plays, so I was fine with accommodating you if needed.

The rest of dinner passed by fairly quickly and without incident, and it was nearly six by the time we were done. Nobody else had come home yet, so it was just the two of us. I was a bit distracted by my own thoughts, so it wasn't until I'd finished and crumpled my napkin onto my empty plate that I actually looked at you again. And then did a double take.

"Wait a minute. Are you... you look bigger now..." I squinted down at you, taking a closer look. Somehow, you'd grown back only a little bit. You were two inches tall now, twice as big as when I'd first found you (or vice versa, to be technically correct). Neither of us had even noticed because your clothes had grown along with you. Lucky that, as I certainly didn't have spare clothes for someone the size of my pinky. I quickly cleaned up from dinner and came back to the table.

I smiled down at you, my expression clearly hopeful. "Okay, so it's not much, but it's something. We can try to see if it happens again. If we're lucky, this might be some sort of effect that's starting to wear off." I moved to pick you up, and my grip might have been a little tight until I adjusted around your bigger figure. It still felt so weird to literally hold you in the palm of my hand, but I certainly wasn't about to say that I was starting to get used to it. Instead, I just continued to smile as I raised you to face level and looked at you.

"In the meanwhile, though, what do you want to do? Watch me play games, or should I set something up for you?"
1541111111111111111111111.title: Streams and Spurts

155.title: Seems Less Extremely Unlikely Now

1551.content:
"Urrrrrgh, why do they have to make all these equations so hard?" I groaned and fell forward; my head thumped against the textbook, while my decently-sized boobs smooshed against the edge of the desk. Another dull school night in my room. My only companions were a bag of Gummy Bears and the infinitely slow passage of time that seemed to accompany the word "work" wherever it went. I huffed and leaned back. "I can't take this anymore. I'll just do the rest of it in English or at lunch."

Standing up, I stretched my tired legs. It was the last year of high school, and at 18, I was ready to be done with the whole affair and off to live my life. My skin was mostly white, but there was still some brown from a distant Mexican ancestry. This also showed in my hair, a dark brown that was nearly bordering on black, straight cut and just past shoulder length. My eyes were a dark blue, and they wandered around the room as I tried to think of something to do to alleviate my boredom.

"Blegh," I scoffed as I let myself collapse backwards onto my bed with a whoomph. Just about everyone I knew was out of town, and the few people still here were too busy with their own schoolwork to do anything these days. I couldn't paint my nails, I'd already done that. I glanced down and wiggled my toes, admiring the vibrant sapphire blue color of the nail polish. Maybe I could watch TV, catch up on some shows. Anything to take my mind off of how very bored and very alone I was.

Out of the corner of my eye, I saw motion. Jumping to a bolt-upright position, I watched, wide eyed and completely startled, as the fabric hem of my dresser shook. If I listened closely enough, I could hear a soft sound, as if something was scurrying around underneath it. My legs snapped up onto the bed as images of disgusting, disease-riddled rats and horrible, greasy cockroaches and terrifyingly huge spiders flashed through my thoughts.

What came out was neither of these things. It was small, only an inch or two tall, and colorfully decorated. The oddest part was that it was taller than it was long, as if it was... standing on two legs? Looking closer, I began to notice how distinctly... human-shaped it was. In fact, my brain concluded after stumbling for a moment or two, that was exactly what it was: a man, barely the size of my pinky, standing at the foot of my dresser.

Eyes wide with shock, I sat there on my bed, legs tucked under me, and stared down at you...
1551.title: Bored Senseless

15511.content:
As I started to come to, I took in my surroundings as best I could. It was dark, or at least it seemed dark. Even when I opened my eyes, things were a blur, although with every blink things were coming back to me. How'd I get here? Where was here? And what'd I do to get this splitting headache?

I sat up, patiently blinking until the blurs around me started to take form. I was...in a dark alleyway? Or some back lot somewhere? I set a hand on the ground to support me as I tried to stand and froze, looking down. It was hard to see, but it felt like...carpet. Really thick carpet. Like, several inches of the stuff.

I pressed against it a few times. "What the hell...?" I looked up at the wall next to me, touching it. It was smooth. Not like any building I'd seen before. I touched the other one. Same deal, slightly different texture, but smooth. And when I looked up, there wasn't a single star in the sky. Hell, it looked like the sky ended half a dozen feet above me. When I looked back away from the wall, I saw light in that direction. Just a little. It looked like some sort of curtain hanging there. Maybe I was actually inside somewhere. That would explain it.

I started to walk toward the curtain, careful not to trip over anything as I came out from between the two "buildings" and into more open ground. I could see the silhouette of a few things strewn about, but nothing concrete in the darkness. Furniture or something, probably. Soon, I reached the curtain, lifting it and seeing light flood in. The ground did look like giant carpet, but that wasn't too weird if I was inside somewhere.

"Here goes nothing..." I lifted the curtain more and stepped out into the light, shielding my eyes as they adjusted. When I could look around, what I saw stunned me. The ground was still carpet. But it was definitely floor. The floor of a giant bedroom, looked like. Above me, the supposed building I'd just left towered as a dresser, and in the distance I saw a desk and other furniture. Directly to the side, I saw a bed. And as I gaped, looking up and up, I froze when I came to meet the eyes of a girl staring right back down at me. Presumably the owner of this room.

I stared, too shocked to move, hoping to god she didn't think I was some sort of bug. "...h-hello."

The word stumbled out a little and I almost expected her to be unable to hear it as I waited for some response, willing myself to be ready to bolt if I needed to.
15511.title: Under the Dresser

155111.content:
The furniture, like the rest of the room was white wood with light blue accents and a general fish theme. There was even a small aquarium set up in the corner. Of course, small was in comparison to a normal person. I could only imagine how absolutely monumental everything in my bedroom, from the furniture to the bean bags to the shag rug by the door, must seem to you, like a man-made landscape.

From this distance, your quiet words were barely more than a whisper, but I was so focused on you that I could just barely make it out. Moving very slowly, like someone approaching a wild animal, I slipped off the bed to kneel on the floor. I stayed there for the moment, not wanting to startle you. "Hi there, uh... little guy..." All things considered, I was taking this remarkably well.

I scooted a little closer and smiled at you. Looking at you, it was easy to notice that you were, well, good-looking. You weren't exactly a Playgirl cover-page model, but from what I could tell between the clothes and the size, you had a decent figure. I tried not to stare too much, focusing on your face.

Why were you only an inch tall? What were you doing in my room? I couldn't deny I was curious, but... well, did it really matter now? You were here, and that was what I knew. Besides, based on how confused you were, it was possible you didn't know either. Of course, if you did, that meant you'd snuck in here for some reason or another. But there was no point to questioning that right now. All I could do now was just introduce myself and go from there.

"I'm Wiley." Another scoot to bring me a bit closer; all the while I kept an eye on you, making sure I wasn't making you too nervous. After all, you could probably duck back underneath the dresser if you so wanted. "So, what's your name, little fella?" I leaned in, my boobs shaking a little.
155111.title: Floor Talk

1551111.content:
It was definitely a girls' room. Of that much I was certain. And only partly because of the girl now hanging off of her bed over me. But right now I had more pressing concerns. Namely, her. I stared up at you, waiting for an answer as you stared back. Finally, you answered. A pleasant, if confused, tone.
