You leaned in, probably to get a closer look, and I could feel your eyes running over me. It was a little disconcerting, but at the same time a little flattering. As you looked me over, I looked back. You were attractive. Quite so, in fact. Dark hair framing a soft face with beautiful dark blue eyes.

And as you leaned forward further, it was hard not to notice your boobs slide over the edge of the bed, bouncing a little as they were freed to hang there. You introduced yourself and I relaxed a little. You didn't seem very dangerous. I found my voice once again, speaking up so you could hear me better.

"I'm Jake...and that's all I'm really sure of right now." At least I had a name. That was something. "Nice to meet you, Wiley."

I paused, thinking for a moment, then spoke again. "You...wouldn't happen to know why I'd find myself an inch tall under your dresser, would you?"

A question in vain most likely, but certainly an ice breaker if nothing else.
1551111.title: Meeting Wiley

15511111.content:
Your uncertain words confirmed my suspicions; you were just as confused by your size and your presence under my dresser as I was. I felt a little disappointed. Even if I was in the moment, I had been curious. Still, I thought as I teetered back to not caring, best not to think about it. Barring any sudden revelations, our knowledge of this started with meeting each other at our respective sizes.

"Sorry, no. And I'm guessing you don't either, since you asked me." I shrugged a little and smiled. "Still, it's nice to meet you, too, Jake. Circumstances notwithstanding." My eyes flitted over you again, unable to resist a bit more ogling. Thoughts danced through my mind. You were so small and, though I didn't think you'd agree, sort of cute like this, like an adorable little pet. Part of me wanted to grab you and cuddle with you. You were, however, still a person, even if only a very tiny one. That and the fact that we'd just met made me feel like taking it easy, at least for now.

Even then, I couldn't help but say, "Not that I really mind the surprise. It's not everyday a good-looking guy crawls out from under my dresser." My face flushed bright red, and I leaned back a little, as if shocked by myself. "I, uh... Sorry. That was probably too forward. Way too forward." My words trailed off into a mumble as I looked down at the floor. Hm, beige carpeting had never been this interesting before...
15511111.title: Partners in Cluelessness

155111111.content:
Even as I was asking, I could tell you had no idea what'd happened to me by the look in your eyes. Those eyes that seemed to keep rolling over my body. Your wandering gaze made me feel a little less guilty about mine wandering all over what I could see of you hanging off the bed.

When you spoke, you confirmed it. As much idea how this had happened as I had. Disappointing. Frustrating. But I supposed things could be worse. I was grateful you were friendly, although that look kept implying some...more than friendly thoughts lurking there. Which I couldn't say I was terribly opposed to, mind wandering toward the possibilities at this size. But I shook the thought away as you spoke again, trying to focus.

When you called me a good-looking guy, I blushed a bit myself, looking down a bit to attempt to hide it in some vain sort of pride, but peeked up to see you were just as flustered as I was, if not more so.

"No...no, it's fine." I smiled at you, trying to unfluster you. "It's just not every day I crawl out from under a good-looking gal's dresser to find her complimenting me."

Oh my god. Did I just flirt? Was I flirting? I must have flushed a bit more, but I didn't look away, figuring it would ruin my unflusterization attempt if I did.
155111111.title: Flustered All Around

1551111111.content:
I had been certain that my face couldn't get any redder. However, your flirting certainly proved that theory wrong. My face was flushed with blood, and I could feel the heat in my cheeks. I'd never been good with talking to people, let alone cute boys. And now was probably really not the best time at all. Still, though, you'd flirted right back after my initial outburst. Could it be that you were actually interested in me, too, despite the current predicament?

What was I thinking? A toy-sized stranger appears from under my dresser, and my first thoughts are about flirting and ogling? What a first impresion. You probably thought I was some kind of super-sized pervert. Of course, I was dressed in some rather skimpy shorts and a midriff-bearing shirt that did little to hide my cleavage, so there was a fair amount to be seen from your end. I scooted a little bit closer to you, which leads to a bit of bouncing. You might smell the sweet fragrances of lavender and vanilla from my body products on me from this distance, or see the soft glossy sheen on my fingernails and toenails from a recent makeover. I smiled down at you, trying to be friendly and reassuring.

"Well, I... thanks, Jake." My blush has settled a bit, but it's still quite obvious on my mostly pale face. "So, if you don't know and I don't know what's going on..." I looked upwards for a moment and thought, tapping a finger against my teeth. What was the proper process for dealing with a shrunken guy? It wasn't like I could just take you down to the police and say, 'Hey, look what I found under my dresser'. Or was it like that? My brain was too befuddled to do any real thinking... or at least, any thinking beyond how handsome and cute you were. I tried again to steer my thoughts away from that and turned back down to you.

"I'm really not sure what to do about this whole... thing..." I made a general waving gesture with my hands. "And it's getting pretty late, so I don't think there's anything more to be done for the night. Do you... maybe wanna sleep here and try to sort things out after I get out of school tomorrow?" I really didn't have time to go anywhere before school started, and first period was a group project thing. No way I could miss that and still expect an A...

Rambling again. Sorry... I focused back on you on the ground, waiting to hear if this plan's all good for you.
1551111111.title: Help, Flirting, and Busy Hours

15511111111.content:
Oh, man. I can't believe I just flirted. I was never like that. I mean, it wasn't like I didn't want to be. I'd thought about it and considered trying to be suave or debonair or any of those words and smoothly letting go some devilishly clever one-liner that led to swooning and the like. But that was all fantasy, and the one time I'd tried, I'd been so nervous that I'd stumbled over the words and gotten only a "What?" in return.

And yet, there I was with a response like that... Maybe it was the pressure of the scenario? She was certainly beautiful, and with more than a little bit on display, a display that you certainly weren't standing against. But what if she'd thought it was stupid? A girl a thousand times your size was not someone to piss off with a dorky one-liner. But... it had worked, I think. I blushed, chuckling nervously under my breath.

As you scooted closer, I looked up just in time to notice that bouncing as the scent of your...bodywash? perfume? whatever it was wafted to me, a gentle mix of scents I couldn't quite place but that I quite enjoyed, a blush coming over my face. I hoped I was too small for it to be noticeable, but something told me it totally was. When you smiled, I smiled back, glad to be reassured that wasn't too dumb a thing to say. You were talking, clearly still thinking things through while you chose your words. I listened along patiently.

"I... yeah, I think that sounds like a pretty good plan. Long as me staying here's not a bother, it works for me." I nodded my approval of the idea, but I did really hope I wasn't being a bother. Not that I'd really chosen this predicament, but I was in it now, and I felt like I was obligated to try to make dealing with it, and me, as easy for Wiley as I could. "Is there somewhere not in the way for me to crash?"
15511111111.title: Sounds Like a Plan

155111111111.content:
Up close like this, I could see you a bit better. You were dressed in a sleeveless, grey T-shirt and a pair of plain white boxers. Well, at least we were in the same boat when it came to being in casual clothes. Granted, your shirt covered all of your torso, but it was still pretty even. I could see the blush on your little face and wondered just what was causing that. Hopefully not the sight of me in such little clothing. I supposed there was a lot of things an inch tall guy could get embarrassed about, really.

Not that any of that really mattered at the moment. Tiny or not, dressed or not, you were in need of help, and I wanted to help. It was the right thing, and it wasn't like my life was terribly exciting and busy otherwise. Plus, as had been made rather obvious by my none-too-sneaky flirting and ogling, I found myself rather interested in you and your attractive figure. You were handsome in your own sort of way, and hopefully you might find me at least a bit appealing in turn...

"Well... I obviously don't have a bed your size..." I gave a short, slightly nervous chuckle as I tried to lighten things up. "But I think I can make up a sort of mattress-y thing for you..." I stand up and walk over to the hutch in the corner. From your perspective on the ground, you could watch as I pulled things from drawers and messed around with something. It wasn't until I came back over and kneeled back down that you'd be able to see my idea. It was one of those little heart-shaped pillows, about as thick and large as a hand. This particular one was in a soft pink hue, and you could easily see that I'd added on a cotton ball for a pillow and a soft silk hankie as a giant sheet. The whole thing looked, to be honest, rather tacky, like the kind of thing you might see in some goofy honeymoon suite.

I laughed again with that same nervous tone. "I, uh... I know it's not exactly ideal, but it's the most comfortable little thing I have. Unless you wanted to curl up on my applicator puff and get powder all over you..." I was clearly very unsure what to do, and when I got nervous, I started to joke around more than I probably should. "Uh, anyways, so there's two options here. This could just go on my nightstand. The problem is that someone might come in and see you, and I think we should probably limit the number of people that know about all... this... until we can maybe find out a little more. Or, if you'd be okay with it, we could put this in the drawer and leave the drawer a little open. You'd have light and air, but it might feel a bit claustrophobic and, uh, you'd be in a drawer. But you'd be hidden from sight."

I fidget a little, resisting the urge to tug on my shirt and pull it down. I was still a bit shy about showing so much skin around you, but you didn't seem to mind and I'd just be drawing attention to it in the process. "Of course, the choice is yours, Jake. I don't want to make you feel uncomfortable, so you can sleep outside the dresser if you'd prefer that..."
155111111111.title: Cheesy Beds and Nervous Laughs

choices: But I'd rather not think about that right now.
1551111111111.content:
I watched as you sat there, thinking, trying to come up with something for me to sleep on. Truth be told, I wasn't picky. I'd slept on the floor more than a few times in my life before I'd shrunk. I could manage something equally bare now, if need be.

But you seemed to get an idea, proclaiming it and walking over to a hutch in the corner. I watched you go, admittedly getting a better look at your figure than I'd had when you were hanging over the edge of the bed. I hadn't realized your shorts were quite so...short. Granted, it was hard to complain. And when you bent over the hutch to root through the drawer, let's just say I admired the view. We both seemed to be getting an eyeful of each other tonight, it just seemed fair. Yeah, let's go with that.

Soon enough, you were finished messing with whatever you'd found, and you came back carrying what amounted to a tiny version of a honeymoon suite bed that at my size was honestly still the size of a king mattress at least. Despite that, you looked unsure about it. So I tried to encourage you. "Hey, it looks great. A bed fit for a tiny emperor." The emperor of Vegas, perhaps. "I'll be happy to sleep in it."

Then the question of location came up. Have to say, I wasn't particularly crazy about sleeping in a drawer. I'd much rather be closer to you and not shut up in a box I couldn't open or get out of without assistance. But I was even less crazy about someone wandering in in the middle of the night and investigating Wiley's new doll on the nightstand. So I thought over the options and decided it was for the best. "I think... if you think it's safer, I'll go with the drawer." I nodded, as if to confirm it.

I mean, how bad could it be? Worst case, there were a few things in there with me. But things weren't a threat. Well, non-moving things. And they certainly didn't have prying eyes like someone wandering in would. I could think of it as an enormous room all to myself if I needed to.

"And thank you, for all of this. Not everyone would be so accommodating to a tiny guy showing up out of the blue." Hell, some would probably abuse it...
1551111111111.title: Decisions Made

1552.content:
The ground shook at an even pace as I walked into the room with a shy smile on my face. "Are you awake now? Sometimes it takes a while for the spell to set in." It would perhaps take a moment to recognize me even at this size, but not too long. I was the 8 year old little brother of one of your acquaintances. You had babysat me a few months ago for the weekend. I was a polite and quiet boy, and so not much trouble. But even back then I had somewhat creeped you out. It wasn't anything in particular, I just had an unsettling little air about me.

As I knelt down over you, my messy brown hair fell over my face, my unnaturally bright blue eyes seeming to shine out beneath it. "I hope you'll be more fun then the others. You're the first grownup that I've shrunk. Normally it was just my siblings or kids at school. I hope you'll be more fun." This was unnerving, because as far as you knew I was an only child. Your friend had never mentioned any other kids, and there was no sign of them when you stayed the weekend with me. That left a few possibilities and none of them were good.

I was wearing a black sweater and shorts, and as I squatted over you I reached down to grab you in my giant hand. "Now I guess I'll show you around the house, since you'll be staying here if all goes well. If not, you'll have to join my siblings."
1552.title: Creepy Little Boy

choices: A Tour and Maybe Some Answers?
15521.content:
As I sat up, clutching my head and trying to figure out what had happened, the world started to shake. I tried to steady myself, looking around for the cause. My eyes fell on an enormous young boy walking through an equally enormous door into...wait, this was all a huge room? I looked around in fear and amazement as you began to speak, listening and growing more worried by the second.

My gaze came back to you, realizing who you were. You were the kid I babysat. Not my usual gig, but when your parents came by begging with no other options, I didn't really have any choice but to accept. You'd been pleasant enough, well-behaved if a little creepy. A pretty easy weekend, all things considered. I hadn't really given you much thought since then, had even forgotten your name, but here you were towering over me and planning god knows what.

...wait, siblings? You were an only child. That's what your parents had told me. A cold chill started to run through me as I considered my current stature and what you could have done to them.

When you reached for me, I was too scared to move. But even if I weren't, where was I going to run? Your grip was a little tight, but not strangling and as you lifted me up and explained you were going to give me a tour, I was far more concerned with that last bit. I didn't want to ask, but not knowing what you'd done was going to be even worse. "Where, uh, where exactly are these siblings of yours?"
15521.title: In the Hands of an Eight-Year Old

choices: Or Lily, the slightly oblivious but well-meaning girl?
Or have we run out of choices again?
1553.content: There were so many people it could have been, in retrospect. Maybe it was...
1553.title: So Many People

15531.content:
The first thing you see upon opening your eyes is, in fact, nothing at all. A seemingly endless white void stretches beyond sight in every direction; no light or shadow exists, and the only hint that there is even a ground is that your feet are resting on something. Some invisible force holds you immobile, and so all you can do is look around at all the nothingness. It's a very surreal experience, both soothing and nauseating, and it gives a bit of a migraine. Though there's no true light source anywhere, the sheer white is almost painfully bright; it's certainly enough to make you squint.

Without warning, your body begins to shiver and shake in a very discomforting and slightly painful manner, as if convulsing and attempting to simultaneously explode and implode. A harsh, high-pitched whine rings in your ears, and your vision blurs. You can still see enough, however, to watch as the brilliant white fades, dulling, to a muted hue of off-purple. Above you, the unpleasant color fades into a bland grey, as if obscured by smoke or some indistinguishable mass of cloud. Even as you blink the fuzziness from your sight, it becomes no more obvious whether it's one or the other. Looking down, you notice two things.

First, the ground is now clearly existent. A featureless hard surface of a creamy, off-white color, with no distinct markings or pattern lies beneath you; it's as expansive as the rest of everything else in this unnatural place and just as mysterious. It feels somewhat warm to the touch, though, as you can feel through your bare feet. That leads to the second thing you've just noticed - you don't have a single shred of clothing on, not even a pair of boxers. Your lack of clothing might not be some tragic disaster, but it certainly doesn't alleviate the sense of discomfort and insignificance that almost seems to ooze forth from your surroundings. At least, you note, you can move now.

Any sort of train of thought abruptly ends, though, as something huge slams down before you. A few feet closer, and you wouldn't be alive to see the sight before you. It's an oddly flat mass of soft, dull purple, with five bulbous masses protruding from the front. Each mass has some sort of rounded translucent stone protruding from it, ringed in brighter tones at the edge. It all seems oddly familiar somehow; your mind snaps to realization as your eyes follow the column rising up from the back of the gigantic foot, up legs as thick as trees and over a torso bare but for a ragged back loincloth - that, you notice, doesn't do much to cover the dangling bits from your perspective. You meet the eyes, cold and unnaturally blue, and stumble back a little. Now fully aware, it's all too easy to take in the full sight of the titanic man before you; he has to be at least four times as tall as you, and he's notably male, from the body hair on his chest and arms and legs to the beard across his chin to the bulge of his crotch. His skin is an unusual shade of purple, but other than that and the impossible size, he seems quite human. You almost come up to his knees, and he seems more than a little amused by your surprise as he towers over you, taller by comparison than a two-story building.

"Right on time. I do so enjoy that expression..."
15531.title: Enigmatic

155311.content:
When I opened my eyes, I immediately regretted it. The question of where I was came to mind, but there didn't seem to be an answer. I was in a void of whiteness with nothing to tell me I was anywhere but something below my feet I couldn't look to see. My body won't move. Or at least, something won't allow it to. As I stare into the void, at least as best as I can through my squinting eyes, my head starts to pound. Yet I stare.

A chill runs up my spine, then back down it, then up again. Then it spreads until my entire body is shivering. It gets more intense. I'm shaking, Shaking violently. It feels like I'm trying to shake both forward and back, then back and forward simultaneously. I shut my eyes and cry out as my body attempts to rip itself apart. I'm not sure if I hear the scream. My ears begin to ring and the void, even devoid of anything beyond the whiteness manages to fade into a blur, then into a strange shade of purple that makes me want to vomit. Slowly it turns to a more bland, but much more tolerable grey and each time I blink my vision begins to return. Somewhere along the line, the shaking stopped and the ringing in my ears vanished.

The floor. Or...the ground? It does exist. I look down and confirm this. It's an off-white, much more pleasant than the white of the void, and it's warm. Comforting... I look down to my own feet, then up the rest of myself, eyes widening as I realize that I'm stark naked with nothing between me and this strange world I've found myself in. Instinctively, I try to cover myself with my hands and find, with some satisfaction, that I can move once more.

But I have little time to enjoy this realization as something enormous and purple crashes down in front of me and my heart leaps into my throat. I fall back in fear, staring at the impossibly huge thing that just fell several feet in front of me and very nearly removed me from this world I'd just arrived in. My gaze rose from the thing, up the purple tower stretching out of it, my mouth gaping wide as I realize that I'm looking at a leg, and attached to it an impossibly large, purple man wearing little more than I was. My eyes continue to climb, and I pull myself back in fright as I meet this man's icy blue eyes staring right back at me.

I stand back up, trying to take in the sight, try to make sense of what's happening. I barely come up to his knee. What's going on!? That's when he speaks. He...expected me? And it sounded like something like this had happened before? My mind flooded with questions. My mouth continued to gape. I stared at him for several seconds. Then the dam holding back my thoughts bursts and out they flow.

"Where am I? Who are you? How did I get here? What are you going to do to me? Please don't kill me..."
155311.title: Meeting a Purple Giant

1553111.content:
The icy stare of those cool blue eyes staring analtyically across your bare figure do little to dissuade any feelings of fear or discomfort. He doesn't really seem to care though; if anything, it only seems to amuse the unnatural titan, judging by the tilting smirk on his face. "You're an awful curious little guy, aren't you?" He tsks, a glamor of disappointment flitting across his features. "I thought you'd have better manners than to be so inquisitive without even introducing yourself. And in your birthday suit, no less!" He huffs and folds his arms.

Suddenly, he explodes in a puff of... colored smoke? Mist? Some sort of gas that quickly dissipates. Before you can look around, he walks from behind you, now only a little taller than yourself. "Not that I mind the peep show, Jake, really," he teases. Those icy eyes flicker and fade into a grassy green; you're held immobile again, though now your body is tingling slightly and you're forced spread eagle. The man, if he can even be called that, chuckles and looks you over. "Actually, you're a bit of a looker. I can see why you were... picked..." The last word, oddly emphasized, sounds more like a decision than a statement, and his voice holds a bit of a guarded tone. But then he's back to smirking, and as you're frozen, he takes the moment for a bit of personal amusement by grabbing hold of your exposed penis. Purple fingers idly fondle and grope against sensitive flesh as he looks down at it, his expression distant and thoughtful. He releases your shaft, but the unfortunate combination of the not-unpleasant tingling and all that... stimulation, leaves it less than flaccid, though not willingly.

"Cute," he says with that same damned smirk. His eyes flicker back to blue, and you find yourself free to move. "Don't bother covering up, human. I'm more than familiar with dicks and modesty will get you nowhere. Besides, you and I will be getting more personal soon enough." He snaps his fingers, and a bar with a bottle of whiskey and two glasses on it pops into existence. The strange person rounds the bar as an apron with "Kiss the Omnipotent Being" written on it materializes over him. "Now, let's talk, Jakey boy. You're in my realm; it's kind of hard to put it in words you'd understand, but let's just say it's a place of emotions. Who am I, you ask? Good question, simple enough. Some of you humans called me Jivolvo way back when, but you can just call me Jeevesy for now."

He pours into both glasses and offers one to you. "Now here's the part you're really not gonna like. I'm not gonna kill you, but that's kind of a moot point. Y'see, you already died. That's why you're here, bub."
1553111.title: Unhelpful

15531111.content:
Somewhere along the line, my line of questioning fades into nothing under the giant's gaze as he...smirks? Wait, was he smirking? Did he think this was funny? When he spoke, I tried to be quieter despite my silence, fearing I'd brought some wrath upon myself. Despite that fear, I couldn't help but notice this man was...oddly human.

And at the moment of that realization, he turned into a cloud of smoke. Great. I gaped at where he used to be, trying to grasp what was going on when I heard his voice again. This time for behind me, less booming. I whipped around when he spoke, freezing in place before I could even reacquire my footing, my legs seeming to spread on their own. Wait...how did he know my name? What was this guy?

Puzzling over this, I watch him move as best as I can as he walks a circle around me, looking me over and stopping in front once more. The compliment didn't make me feel any better, and only brought more questions. Picked? What the hell? But even if I could have shown my discontent, it was interrupted by an abrupt hand gripping my junk. A chill runs up my spine as I'm handled, frozen lips trying to let out a gasp and limbs trying against impossible odds to step away from the uninvited groping. And when he steps back, I find to my disavail that my body approved where I didn't.

He remarks on it briefly and suddenly I'm free again, immediately taking a few steps back before settling myself and trying to cover up my blatant erection. I try to ask how he knows me and what he's talking about, but he's talking again before I can. I let my hands fall to my sides. He's got a point... but more personal? Seriously, what the hell?

He snaps and before my eyes appears a bar, a bottle of what can only be whiskey and two glasses sitting on top of it. God, I could use a drink... My captor was now wearing an apron flaunting himself as an omnipotent being...and to be honest, that was the first thing to make this scenario make any sense all day, if just a little. Then he's talking again. Using my name again... His realm...? Jivolvo? So he was some sort of god?

The idea fit solidly enough, but the concept just couldn't click as real. Why would a god just be kicking around on Earth? Or...wherever the hell we were. When he offered me the glass, I stepped over and took it graciously with a mumbled "Thank you." Then I took a long swig, savoring the familiar burn as it went down and hoping the other effects would hit sooner rather than later and take the edge off.

That was when his voice turned a bit more serious. And with each word, the pit in my stomach felt heavier and heavier. I stared into my drink for a few moments after he finished speaking. "I'm...I'm dead...?"

It didn't seem real. My next questions came slower than my last barrage, trickling out of me as I tried to understand it all. "But...how? When? I was perfectly healthy. I... I was living a normal life. I think... You said I was picked... Did...did someone kill me?"

And on top of that, why was I here? I wasn't exactly an adherent believer in pearly gates and fiery pits, but this didn't line up with anything I knew of...which made sense, in a way.

I shook my head, throwing back another swig of whiskey, the glass almost empty now, and all my questions molded into one short one.

"..Why?"
15531111.title: Confusion

155311111.content:
At first, there is no answer, only a long stretch of silence that fills the empty void around you. Besides the bar, the drinks, and the two of you, the terrain of this muted landscape is a barren waste. A faint sweet smell can be sensed in the cool wind that whispers across you, and the very air seems to bear a sort of clinging, muggy weight. Dark clouds roll through the gray sky overhead. Jivolvo regards his drink for a moment and sets it onto the bar.

"... I don't know." The sentence draws out, as if he were contemplating every syllable before letting it past his lips. "Or, to be more exact, we don't know." He prods at your chest with a finger, and you're nudged back to sit in a soft chair that definitely wasn't there a moment ago. The purple-skinned man sits down in a similar chair and crosses his legs. "Usually when you pass on, you're aware of your own passing and can recall what happened. In most cases, you even appear in a clean version of whatever you were wearing at the time of death." He leans forward and purses his lips. "What's interesting about you, though, is that you are, for all intents and purposes, a blank slate. You have a name and vague memories, but you have absolutely no information or special characteristics about your death or being."

Thunder rumbles in the distance, and Jivolvo's mouth shifts into a slight frown. "Your essence, or soul if you'd prefer, was floating in the great aether, without any direction or claim upon it. Obviously, I managed to find you, but that raises two very curious questions: what happened that turned you from a living person into a blank soul, and why?"

He stands, chair vanishing out of existence, and starts to pace back and forth before you. The chef's apron, the only article he's wearing, shifts into a dark red cape that flaps in the wind. "It could be a mere accident, a cosmic hiccup in the grand scheme of things, but I'm inclined to think otherwise. Given the right circumstances, a blank soul can be very malleable in any number of ways. There's also sheer energy to be considered, potentially as a weapon of some sort. Your condition could even be the symptom of some new force at play. Of course, speculation is just speculation without any sort of basis or information."

He turns to you, grabbing the bottle of whiskey from the bar, and reaches out to refill your glass. "So! Here is my proposition for you, dear Jake. I'd like to help you out. I can point you to where you can learn things about your condition, and I can help with whatever might come about. If it all ends up shiny, I might even be able to send you back to your physical body and your life. A cosmic Get Out of Jail Free card."

Thunder rumbles again, louder than before, and his eyes flash to a muted jade green. "Interested?"
155311111.title: Pensive

choices: Questioning a god. Never a bad move.
1553111111.content:
Silence fills the air, sending a chill up your spine. There was something about a so-claimed omnipotent being not having an answer to a question that was just... unnerving, in the worst way. I finished off my glass, then stared as he considered his own, waiting for any response. Even an "I don't know" would do at this point.

And then it comes. And my stomach becomes a lead weight. Suddenly I regret my last thought. And then he turns it around, seemingly blaming me as much as himself. His finger prods me in the chest and I stumble back, waiting to hit the ground but landing instead in an admittedly quite comfortable chair. But it does little to calm me, watching him sit across from me in a chair of his own, weather ominously shifting all around us, as I try to grasp exactly what he's telling me.

It means nothing to me. I mean, I can put meanings to words, and figure out what's apparently happened, but at the same time, the whole happening is just so damned incomprehensible. So inconceivable. I just sort of sit and stare, baffled as he carries on, half explaining to me, but apparently half thinking out loud as well.

He stands, apron shifting into a cape as he does. I remain seated, not sure I trust myself to stand right now, and listen as his explanation becomes more and more out of my range of understanding. He's talking like there's some sort of... cosmic unrest, I guess? Like whatever happened to me is some sort of ingenious plan by someone else like him? But then why was I just floating around in a void? And didn't he say something about me being picked? None of this was adding up, and the whiskey I'd had far too quickly was starting to go to my head. There were questions that needed asking, and answering.

Still, he grabs the bottle, refilling my glass and turning the conversation from cosmic whatever back toward me. As he details his offer, I'm inclined to jump up and shake his hand before he's finished talking. And I almost do exactly that, but something holds me back.

"Am I interested...? Extremely... And let's be honest here. In a moment, I'm gonna stand up and shake your hand, consequences be damned. Because I have no other choice and if I live to see another offer, none will ever compare to this one... But I still have to ask, with as little offense as possible, I hope... Why help me? What are you getting out of this?"
1553111111.title: Headache

choices: Or do you have any other questions?
15531111111.content:
The cool wind settles to a still around you, and the mugginess and sweet smell of the air starts to build around you, making every breath a bit more of an effort. At the same time, you can feel something inside yourself. Your whole body shivers involuntarily, and things get a little less clear. The very air you breathe seems to possess an aphrodisiac-like effect, triggering certain reactions and stirring lower, less organized sections of the mind.

Jivolvo contemplates your bold questions for a moment. His pale green eyes stare at you, sitting naked in the soft chair, and you can practically feel those dark pupils pierce through you. His gaze is like that of a predator, cold and calculating, and yet also holds an odd sort of sad warmth, like a protector judging what to say to the one it guards. Whether or not he's aware of how the air is starting to affect you is uncertain, but regardless he turns from you and paces slowly to the bar. The cape dissipates into mist and fades away as he leans forward over the bar and... looks down?

There's a distinct pop, and you suddenly feel the chair shift under you, as if nudged by some invisible force. The environment around you has changed again. The ground is now some kind of smooth brown surface that drops off into a grey abyss. It's oddly patterned with darker markings that seem organic in nature, and it has an unusual glossy sheen. Your observation of the ground is disrupted as a massive shadow casts over you. You look up to see Jivolvo, towering over you at what must be a couple hundred feet or more. It might take a moment to connect the dots and realize you've been shrunken and transported onto the bar, now barely a few inches tall by comparison to the looming purple entity.

"Well, now..." comes his reply, loud and deep like the rumbling thunder that still echoes in the cloudy skies overhead. "That is quite a question. After all, why would someone like me help someone like you?" His fingers tap against the wood before you, drumming out a short, repeating pattern. The air is even thicker now, and it seems to almost cling to you, stirring your body's reactions and raising your temperature slowly but steadily. "I suppose it might seem odd from your perspective. I'm so powerful and all, so what interest might I have in a single soul?" He leans closer, and you can feel and smell his hot breath wash over you as he speaks. "Just one, tiny soul... Unclaimed and unprotected... You could have wound up eaten as a snack or used up like a battery..."

He leans back and strokes his bearded chin as he stares down at you on the cool wooden surface. "If you must know, I suppose you could boil it down to three simple things. First..." He taps the counter with a single finger. "Consider it an act of mercy. If it were me adrift in the Aether, unbound and without purpose, I would want someone to help me out and try to figure out what happened, too. Second..." Another tap, this one closer to you. "I am what you might call a bit nosy. Your case interests me, and I am quite curious to see how things develop and what becomes of your body and your soul. And third..." Another tap, and his finger lands quite close to you. "Well, that's a bit complicated. Let's just say that this whole thing might get me back on the scene of things and moving somewhere."

A loud crack of thunder booms overhead, and dark clouds shift in the sky as his lips shift into a slight smile. "Is that answer satisfactory, Jake?"
15531111111.title: Hefty

choices: And what do I have to do?
155311111111.content:
As the air gets thick with...something, my mind starts to haze a little more. Something on top of the whiskey, poking and prodding at urges that have no place in a conversation as serious as this one, yet that are now cropping up nonetheless. I try to shake it away, but the feeling persists. On top of it, it becomes very clear very quickly that I've made a poor decision asking these questions. Jivolvo's eyes are staring a thousand miles beyond me but still right at me, and the look on his face says I should have just shut up and agreed when I'd had the chance. I gulped, wanting another swig of whiskey but deciding against in my current state.

He stands up, and I watch as he paces to the bar, looking down at... what is he looking at? It's an empty bar to- Before I finish my thought, everything suddenly shifts. I clutch the chair's arms fruitlessly until it settles back into place wherever it now is. The ground is smoother now, darker. Sort of... brown. I look down, turning pale as I realize where I recognize this texture, and becoming afraid to look back up as a shadow looms over. Still, I turn my head slowly toward the sky to realize I'm what's so interesting on the bar top, the purple god towering over me like a mountain. Oh, the mistakes I've made...

His voice booms and I shrink (apt wording) further into the chair as he begins to explain. With each point, his finger, bigger than my entire body drops onto the bar. And with each point, it gets closer to my miniscule form and the chair it sits in. The final point brings with it a prodding far too close to me for comfort, leaving me speechless, able to keep from whimpering but just barely as thunder cracks dramatically above him to punctuate his final question. I open my mouth wordlessly a few times, then manage to find my voice.

"It... it's more than satisfactory. Truly... I-I'm very interested in this deal you offered... How do we start?"
155311111111.title: No More Questions. Well, One, But...

1553111111111.content:
Jivolvo grins and shifts down, fading into smoke and reappearing at your size beside the chair. As the smoke dissipates in the air, the smell of the aphrodisiac-like effect gets even stronger, overwhelming your sense of smell. Every breath tastes warm and a little salty, and a quiet ringing echoes in your ears. Luckily, the warmth is a welcome comfort to your naked body, but that still leaves you very exposed as the chemical reactions boil over in your body like a closed pot. Jivolvo's hand brushes against your bare shoulder, and a cool electrical tingle shudders through you.

The being grins down at you as you sit there. "Hey, relax a little. You're in good hands here, and I don't harm guests that I bring in here. Fair warning , though, I do like to tease..." He chuckles and leans closer to you, his face only a few inches from yours. "I always follow through, of course. Never good to leave people hanging, hmm?"

There's a none-too-stealthy glance down to your crotch before he stands upright and paces a couple steps away. "Starting is simple. You just need to find out how to learn more about your death and what you need to get back home. I know a couple persons who might be able to help with that, even if they are a bit... odd. Rather unusual by your standards, I would say. Still, it's something, so you should go visit them."

Jivolvo shifts, his purple figure bulking up with more muscle. His beard shifts to sideburns and a small buzzcut of black hair appears on his head. A pair of dusk black boxers pop onto him as he turns towards you again, and you can see that there's a rather definite treasure trail that leads down from his pecs. "Now then, I think it's time for a little bit of honesty."

"As an entity, I feed off of sexual energy. Attraction, arousal, stimulation, intercourse... That sort of thing. My own state won't help me, so I have to absorb the ambient energy of others. I am a bit dry at the moment, so you'll have to make up for the "travel fees" of sending you places. This time, I'll let you decide just how I draw that energy out of you, Jake. You've got your hand there if you feel like a solo show, but I certainly won't mind helping out..."

The purple being shifts again, losing muscle mass and body hair. Pecs reshape into a hefty bosom as hips widen and shoulders contract. The result is a very feminine woman with long black hair and only a pair of boxers on. "I can be like this if it helps... I understand how you young men are, always after certain... things..."
1553111111111.title: Advancing

15532.content:
As you try to get adjusted to your surroundings, you would feel that you were on soft and comfy fibers of carpet. It wasn't so bright at all, the quite "large" room being poorly lit by a few light sources. The silence around you began to shift, the loud thumps and vibrations shook you over like continuous tremors. This only happened to feel closer as each tremor went on and on, and then stop altogether abruptly. A "click" was all loud and clear, followed by the creaking of wood. You couldn't see that well on who happened to walk in, thanks to the dim lighting, but the figure of this person appeared like a slim teen girl. From your point of view, she looked like a skyscraper.

This was me, Lily Lancaster, a high school senior. For once, I'm left alone at the house, my parents decided to have their week-long honeymoon vacation...thank god I was an only child. I didn't really find anything so interesting in life, pretty much stuck in my "fantasies" in my free time, but I always wondered what would make everything for me interesting.

"So? What time are you coming over?...of course there's no one over at my house," I say over to my cell phone, walking into my barely lit room, kicking the door behind me closed. With me being quite occupied with the phone call, I wouldn't realize that there was at least some tiny person on my bedroom floor. Growing a little impatient that this call was taking forever, I wiggle my toes of my exposed bare feet, a slight stench lingered from the moist sweat. To you, even my pinky toe appeared just as big as you are. "Alright, I'll see you later," I finally close off the call, glad that was over. Exhausted from school and today overall, I drop my backpack onto the carpet floor, just a few inches away from accidentally crushing you below. I walk over to my bed, which wasn't so far from where you were, and I sit at my bed's edge while bringing out my laptop. My bare feet's soles hovered over you so closely, that would be intimidating to have that big of feet appear like a single misstep would end you. I didn't know the slightest about you being there, and I wouldn't figure out any time soon.
15532.title: Unaware Lily

155321.content:
As I sat up, I dragged my hands along the floor to find it was...carpet? I rubbed my hands along it again to double check. Yes, these felt like giant carpet fibers. Some sort of super shag, maybe? I shook my head, peering around in the darkness and trying to get a better look at it, but there wasn't a whole lot I could really make out, my eyes still adjusting...

That was when the earth started to shake. Short, periodic shakes. Like a giant walking if that were a thing that existed. Each time it got worse. I laid down, gripping the carpet as best I could and waiting for it to end. Suddenly, in the distance, what couldn't be, but really could only be an impossibly huge door opened, and in the light coming from behind it, I saw the silhouette of... a girl? But, how was she so big? Or, how was I so small? None of this made any sense! I stared at her, squinting in the light as I wracked my brain for answers.

I didn't get a very good look before she kicked the door closed and the room was dark once more. Just as I was starting to see, she had to blind me with that. Great... But my sarcasm didn't last long as she started to walk again, each step shaking the floor as I watched the figure slip through the darkness with what at her size might have been called grace.

I leapt to my feet, trying to keep balanced as the ground shook and she walked right over me, talking to someone on what I assumed was her cell phone. Her foot soared over me, several inches above, terrifying and awe-inspiring. I got a brief whiff of her sweat and decided to try to avoid any more of it as best as I could. I watched her walk, but was startled out of it when an enormous backpack dropped to the floor several inches away, nearly crushing me. My heart pounded in my chest, and I turned back to look at the girl, the owner of what I was starting to see was probably her room, as she sat on a giant bed, hanging her feet not far from me. Every part of her was massive. Her pinky toe was at least as long as I was tall. Hell, I could probably fit between her toes and she wouldn't even notice... I shivered at the strange thought.

But right now, I had to focus on something else. I had to get this girl's attention before she stepped on me or something. But...how? I decided to start with the obvious. Her feet dangled too close for comfort. I supposed if I had to, I could probably climb...but I really didn't want to touch them if I didn't have to.

"Hey! Hey, look down here! On your floor! Hey, miss! Heeeeey!"

I shouted, waving my arms and hoping she might hear me, the growing pit in my stomach telling me it wouldn't be enough. This might be a long day...
155321.title: Lily's Room

1553211.content:
I was quite into my zone, since I had so much time to myself before my parents return from their week-long vacation. Well, it was some time, probably an hour before my friend, Jamie, would come over. Might as well find something to do on the internet before then. Luckily, I didn't decide to plug in my headphones this time, a faint voice managed to pull me out of my internet craze. Since when was someone in this house? I was certainly the only one here...right?

My curiosity getting the best of me, I put aside my laptop on my bed and dart my eyes around. Just me and my room from hindsight. But then again...I did hear that distant sound coming from the floor. Feeling a bit like an idiot, I take a glimpse of the carpet floor of my room for anything. Sure, there was my backpack and the other scattered pieces of clothing on the floor...but there was some small figure on the ground. Well...the lighting in the room wasn't really helping, because I couldn't piece it together on what I was staring at.

Due to my exhausted and tired mind (thanks to school), I had a single thought dominate my mind, since I couldn't decipher on what small thing was on my room floor. It had to be some weird bug. That was the only normal thing I could think of, and I wasn't going to turn on my lights as I felt entirely sure that it was a bug.

This would be over with quick and easy, raising my right foot over the assumed bug. Soon, I send my bare foot straight down towards the poor bug to crush it, I had the intentions to kill it on the spot. It's not like the bug would be able to dodge my descending foot...right?
1553211.title: You get her attention...sorta

choices: Meanwhile, what was she up to?
15532111.content:
"Hey! Heeeey!" In the middle of waving my arms, I noticed the girl stir and start to sit up. She heard me. She heard me! I grinned as I saw her face come into view, her eyes scanning the carpet until they fell on me. I jumped up and down. "Yes, me! Help me out here!"

She stared at me for longer than I would have liked, seeming to try to process what exactly she was looking at. I couldn't blame her. I certainly wasn't accustomed to being this small. I can't imagine why she'd just suddenly accept a tiny guy on her floor. But finally, she started moving. She was doing something.

...oh god. My grin dropped into an expression of horror as she moved her massive foot over me. "No, no, no..."

I frantically turned around, sprinting and just barely making it out as the foot came crashing down where I was moments before. When it hit the ground, I was tossed into the air with the force, falling on my face before I could get very far away. I rolled over, crying out in anger. "I'm not a bug! Turn on a light, damn it!"

I quickly righted myself and kept running, not wanting to give her another shot. I ran behind her backpack. She'd have to move it to get to me here. If she even saw me get away in this dark room.

I might need a new game plan...some way to get close enough that she'll see I'm not a bug. Climbing furniture? Maybe. Or maybe I could hitch a ride on some of the clothes strewn on the floor. Not ideal, but that might work. It'd certainly get me close enough... I sighed, trying to think of the best plan.
15532111.title: On the Run

choices: How will you get her attention now?
155321111.content:
Right after stomping my foot onto the floor, I could had sworn I was starting to hear that faint voice again. Though...I could be just imagining it, I was tired as hell right now. Whether or not I managed to kill that bug, I didn't want to start tearing up my room just to kill it. Giving up with the whole bug chase, I go straight back to my internet stuff, right back to my laptop. What was I even freaking out about a bug anyways?

Again, I didn't decide to listen to music, something about the silence in my room was a little refreshing. At least to me, that is. My conscious in the back of my head is repeatedly telling me to clean up my damn room, but I have until a week, so it didn't matter to me now if I decided to pick up all of my scattered clothing. Hell, even my bed was an overall mess, the blankets and sheets almost falling off of my bed and touching the floor from the side I was sitting on.

Finally, I was back into my zone, pretty much just me blogging online. The only things that would get me off my laptop is when my friend comes over in about half an hour...or even something else that happens to grab my attention again.
155321111.title: Back to Square One

1553211111.content:
Lucky for me, she doesn't seem too interested in pursuing me. I slid down the side of the bag until I'm sitting on the floor, looking around for any sign of what to do next. Clothes were a long shot, and god knows I didn't want to end up tossed in a hamper or something if she didn't notice me... Most of the furniture wasn't exactly suited to climbing...I looked around the side of the bag toward the bed again. If I could get up there and get in sight where she'd have to see I wasn't a bug...then I could get somewhere.

I noticed the sheets were hanging loosely off the side of the bed and nodded to myself. Climbing up there with her wasn't the safest plan, but damned if I could come up with a better one right now. I hurried toward the sheets, glad she was distracted and keeping my mouth shut lest I test fate and face her foot again. It was a short walk, but it still took several minutes. Did she say she had a friend coming over? When was that? Time was kind of blurry in this surreal, giant world. Getting anywhere took forever...

I tried not to focus on that, taking hold of the sheets and finding I could pull myself up fairly easily, if not quickly. But a short while later, uninterrupted, I made it to the mattress, tired but close to my goal. Now I just had to make it to her laptop without getting crushed or rolled on or something on the way there...

Well, no time to waste. I caught by breath after the climb and began my trek across the bed, keeping my eyes on this girl all the while.
1553211111.title: How will you get her attention now?

15532111111.content:
My fingers typed away on the laptop's keyboard rapidly, this was my favorite pastime after all: blogging and such. After some minutes, I still pondered on the whole "hearing things" from earlier. I did hear something...it's just that I didn't see anyone or anything that would had said it. Guess I imagine things a lot when I'm alone for more than a day.

Next to me, my iPhone 5 vibrated on the bed mattress, and at first I was going to ignore it. But then again, I had to check, sighing a bit as I stopped typing. My hand reaching over to my phone, and seeing that it was just a check-up text message from my parents. Well...I just sent to them a simple "I'm good" text message back, there really wasn't much to say than the fact that I was alone. After sending that message, I put my phone back onto the mattress, right next to me.

To the tiny guy I didn't know of yet, my phone was placed rather close to you. Then it was back on my laptop once again, distracted from anything that would happen. Time sure flies fast, but I wondered how long it takes my friend to get over to my house. She did live 5 blocks away in the first place, but she does take awhile to get ready for anything. It was all waiting for me, for something to at least happen.
15532111111.title: Distractions, Distractions

155321111111.content:
I surveyed the bed before me before starting my journey. There was the girl, of course, typing away on her laptop by the looks of it, completely unaware I was here. Her phone was laying next to her on the otherwise pretty bare bed. Should be an easy walk.

And so I went, crossing the mattress. It was quicker than walking through the thick carpet or climbing the dangling sheets, but it still wasn't anywhere close to quick going. I sighed, about halfway across when I noticed the giant phone sitting next to me. If I laid down next to it, it'd still be several times my height. This was ridiculous...

Suddenly, it started to vibrate and I fell back in shock as it shook the bed underneath me, unnoticeable to her probably. but a small earthquake to me. I saw her sigh and reach back without even looking, crawling back from it to let her enormous hand carry it away, type something and then carry it back. As she went back to her computer, I stared at the phone, wondering if I could use it somehow to get her attention. But by the time I hit the unlock button, if I could push it hard enough this small, and got to the slider, the screen'd be off again. Let alone actually typing out a message without walking on every letter in between. I was better off trying more directly.

So I carried on. I tried to keep a fair distance from the girl, not wanting to be accidentally run over by her arm or something, and when I reached roughly her elbow, I looked up at her. I had to get into her vision. Not the peripheral, then I might just look like a bug again and she might swat without looking. There was no guarantee she'd hear my voice. So I had to be quick.

I prepared myself, then started jogging toward the laptop. When I felt suitably close, I looked at her again and started waving my arms.

"Hey! Hey, down here! I'm not a bug, look!"
155321111111.title: Making My Move

1553211111111.content:
After a set of minutes of me typing away, my attention was grabbed once again by that faint voice. But this time, I could hear it a little more clearer than the other times I've heard it. It sounded like it was coming from right beside me, calling out for some reason. I had to be alone in this room, there was certainly no one else here. That idiotic feeling surrounded me as I took a quick glimpse to my side, and I found a figure that was familiar to me from some time ago.

A small figure stood on my bed, not too much than an inch tall. Even if it was dark, the figure really looked like a man, but if this was real...why was he so small!?!!! I blinked several times to make sure this was real, and come to think of it...he seemed like the same thing I mistaked for a bug on my floor. Another precaution if I was dreaming or not, I gently poked him with my pointer finger, being as gentle as possible just in case I accidentally hurt him. Alright, this was definitely real. "...Erm, hi?" I recollect myself from the weird discovery.
1553211111111.title: Awkward Realization

15532111111111.content:
Again, that horrible waiting while she pieced together that she'd heard me and finally looked my way. It felt like ages, but finally she turned and the look of surprise told me she knew I wasn't a bug this time. I sighed with relief, waiting patiently while she figured out exactly what she was looking at, only flinching away a little when she poked at me, letting her see I wasn't a hallucination or something. Finally, she spoke.

...and I realized I had no idea what to say.

"Uh...hi. This is gonna sound weird. But I just sort of woke up here. On your floor... Tiny... Which is to say, I'm not usually this size. I'm not really sure why I am or how I got here, but I am. And now I don't know what to do, but I figured getting someone's attention was a good first step, so...here I am."

Well, that was a rambling mess. But I think I at least got my point across.

"Oh. I'm Jake, by the way..."
15532111111111.title: Discovered at Last

155321111111111.content:
Once I heard him respond to me, I was for sure certain this wasn't a joke from my brain. At the same time, this was a new definition of weird. I mean, I would be confused as much as this guy if I woke up in some stranger's room a few inches tall. Of course I was going to help out Jake, but then again...I wasn't so sure how. I didn't even know how he got to my room in the first place either.

"I guess that explains a little bit...my name's Lily, and...sorry about what happened earlier," I responded, also adding in an apology for mistakening him as a bug some time ago. I would had actually killed him back there, at least now I'm aware of this. "So, since we both kinda don't know what started this mess, you can stay with me until we figure out something..." I was definitely okay with this...well, until my parents come home, but that's a long time from now. For a moment, even if he was at a small size and hard to see that clearly in the dark, I don't know but I feel a little attracted to him.

But then I put the main matter back into my mind, enough fantasizing. As I waited for your response, the doorbell went off, reminding me of something I had forgotten since I finally discovered Jake. I definitely forgot about Jamie coming over, and I knew I couldn't let her see him at all. Being friends with her for the longest, and I know how "extreme" her fantasies are whenever she decides to spill it out to me. First of all, I didn't want to hide him somewhere in my room, I just couldn't stand leaving him where I wouldn't be able to help him if something happened. So, without giving Jake much input on what was going on, I quickly and gently picked him up and stuffed him into my jeans pocket. At least there, I would feel him no matter what.

"Just hold on, okay? I can't let my friend see you," I say so at least it reassures him that I was looking out for him. Knowing that Jamie was waiting for me to open the door, I walked out of my room and headed for the front door, but not so fast so I wouldn't give him a bumpy ride.
155321111111111.title: Not Much Time to Think

1553211111111111.content:
Lily, huh? Not a bad name. And now that I was getting a better look at her, illuminated by the laptop screen, she was pretty, well, pretty...But now was not the time for that. I pushed those thoughts away, listening as she spoke. I was glad she was sorry, but I wasn't going to bring up the almost squashing. She hadn't know, and truth be told, I was happy enough to forget about that scrape with death...

"Thank you... I promise I won't be much of a hassle." She didn't seem particularly upset about it, but I did still feel a little bad intruding on her this way. Even if it wasn't my choice and I just sort of wound up here.

Suddenly, in the distance I heard the door bell ring. This must be Lily's friend come to hang out or whatever it was they had planned. I looked up to Lily, who seemed to be thinking over something very important. I wondered who her friend was, and if she'd be as accepting of my stature. The last thing I wanted was to be mistaken for a bug again. Lily looked like she'd come to a decision on whatever was bugging her and before I had much time to think, I was suspended in the air, lifted gently by her. and carried toward an opened pocket.

"Hey, wai-" Before I could get two words out, I was dropped inside, slipping in, now pressed between the fabric of her jeans and her leg, a snug but not terribly uncomfortable fit.

Couldn't let her see me...? Well, that didn't bode well. But maybe it was just until she explained the situation. I mean, it was crazy, but explain it, then show me and it should be easy enough to understand. We'd both taken to it fairly quickly. Still, off Lily went, presumably to the door to let her friend in. The ride was a little bumpy. Each step shifted me a little, but thanks to the tightness of her jeans, I was kept from bouncing around pretty well. I waited patiently in the warm pocket, wanting to hear this conversation and get a feel for the new girl.
1553211111111111.title: Pocketed

15532111111111111.content:
Heading up to the front door of my house, I take a quick moment to check if he was still in my pocket, and obviously he was still here. With that checked, I finally unlock the door and open it wide to see a close friend of mine from school. Jamie was roughly almost the same height as me, just a bit taller. Some people like to call us opposites based on our appearances and personalities. While Jamie had her short curly auburn hair, I had my straight blonde hair that went all the way down to my elbows. Personality-wise, I was seen with a more simple and quiet attitude, and Jamie's the one that doesn't think twice of consequences before her actions with the fact that she over-exaggerates too. But hey, that didn't rule out that we were friends in the first place. Though, knowing Jamie that well, I knew she would be a little irrational if she ever finds out of my tiny passenger in my pocket.

"Hey Jamie, that took awhile for you to get here...and you've brought your dog too," I smiled as she walks in, holding the make-shift leash she had for her german sherpard dog. "That's what took me so long to get here Lily! My parents told me to bring Wendy over if I were going to go out. I hope that's fine with you," she says with some exclamation. Once they were in, I closed the door, while remarking,"Sure, I'm alright with that. Just hope Wendy's potty trained, or else I'm not cleaning after it." Jamie only laughs a bit at my subtle joke, it's like she takes everything as a joke

For a moment, I noticed that the dog began to sniff my pocket, oh god, Wendy probably could smell the tiny passenger in my pocket. "So, what have you been doing here? I mean, your parents went on vacation yesterday," Jamie brings this up, her curiosity has been her best quality, and it never fails her. "Just blogging. It is a hobby after all," I said, that was pretty much the normal portion of what happened with me so far.

Then again, while I lead Jamie to the living room of the house, Wendy began to sniff at the pocket where Jake was in, but this time really taking a whiff as if the dog knew there was a stranger in my pocket. Probably after all of that dog sniffing, Wendy began to bark loudly at my pocket, and was about to bite at my jeans and also Jake. Moments before, I tumbled backwards to avoid the agitated dog, falling over on my butt roughly. That fall was a little unexpected, but....I didn't feel Jake's tiny body in my pocket anymore. Shit! Did he fall out when I landed? Luckily Jamie wasn't looking this way, she's busy trying to calm down her dog, but I couldn't figure out where he had fallen. Great, I couldn't see him on the carpet floor anywhere near me, he probably tumbled off under the couch that was beside me.

"Er, sorry about that Lily. That usually doesn't happen with Wendy at all," Jamie put her attention back on me, and I mentally cursed. Guess I can't look for him right now, I get back on my feet after the fall. "I'm fine, so it's okay," I simply say, but I worried on where he was.
15532111111111111.title: Jamie Comes In

155321111111111111.content:
A short, reasonably pleasant pocket ride later, I looked up as Lily checked to make sure I was still here, which naturally I was. I gave her a thumbs up and she turned back to, presumably, the door. I listened intently from the pocket as it opened and her friend came in...Jamie, was it? And...a dog. I hadn't considered animals at this size. The thought of being snapped up in an instant flashed through my mind, and I tried to push it away with a shiver.

I focused on their conversation. Jamie sounded nice enough, but how much could you really judge on someone's voice?I heard another noise alarmingly close to me. Beginning to be frightened, I recognized a dog's sniffing directly behind me, and it wasn't moving. This dog had my scent and it was big enough to sniff Lily's pocket. I wanted no part of this.

As Lily talked, she started moving again, taking me away momentarily before the dog caught up, sniffing more. Abruptly, it started barking, scaring the hell out of me. That was when everything went nuts. Lily fell over, either pushed by the dog or by tripping on her own. But as she fell, her pocket twisted open just right and when she hit the ground, I was launched out of it, catapulting briefly through the air and coming to a stop under the couch. When I hit the ground, I rolled a bit further, and as soon as I had my senses, ran further in where I figured the dog probably couldn't fit.

Looking out, I saw Lily on the floor, Jamie's feet and what looked to be a German Shepard. Great. Just the breed I wanted in this situation. If nothing else, I was fairly certain it was too big to get under here. And thank god for that. Two seconds with those teeth and I was dog food.

I figured Lily was probably looking for me, but with her friend right there, she probably couldn't look too hard without explaining. And I didn't blame her for wanting to avoid that. But I was trapped here until she could grab me or the dog went somewhere else.

I stayed there, under the couch, watching and waiting for some sort of opening to get back to her. Or hell, to Jamie. I wasn't going to be picky when the alternative was dog hunting.
155321111111111111.title: Alone Again

1553211111111111111.content:
There was so much going on in my head, I really needed to get Jake out of this situation before it becomes unnecessarily worse. Out of all the factors that would make this worse, Jamie's dog had to go outside. I couldn't imagine him being Wendy's chew toy, just had to get that factor out and done with, and it would be easy for Jamie to understand as Wendy appeared as if she were about to maul me. "Just in case your dog has another...er, aggression moment, you can leave Wendy outside in the backyard. She might soon tear up the furniture and stuff," I say in suggestion, knowing what she was going to say next.

"Sure, that's completely fine. Don't want ol' Lilly-Milly getting in trouble 'cus of my dog," Jamie grins at me, bringing up the specific nickname that she had called me before back in the 3rd grade. As much as we are friends, something about that nickname feels so weird after hearing it again at this age. "I'm going to get the TV on, hopefully there's something good on," I add, just having the feeling I should say something just to keep my friend occupied on what I'm doing.

With Jamie tending to her dog and heading for the backyard, I had just about some tight time before she brings her attention back to me. I get myself down on the floor, peeking under the couch and seeing that he was hiding under there after the sudden fall. It was either wait and hide there or get mauled over by the dog. Quick, I try to reach my arm under the couch, using my hand to feel if I get a hold of him. A few more moments and I would had gotten him in my grasp, but Jamie's voice catches me off-guard.

"Let me guess, the TV remote's under the couch again. Geez, let me get it for ya. I could probably reach it," Jamie notices me reaching my arm under the couch, assuming that I was trying to get the TV remote. Well...I couldn't really tell how this would end up, but before I could even comment on this, Jamie gently pushes me aside and reaches her arm under the couch. Soon, she manages to get a grip over Jake, and I could tell by her confused expression upon feeling him. "Um..." she mumbles in confusion, pulling her arm out from under the couch and seeing Jake in-between her index finger and thumb. A feeling of complete awkwardness surrounded me, and I abruptly blurt out,"Before you start to think anything funny Jamie, I could explain this whole thing. It's a rather long story."

It was silent for some moments, Jamie curiously stared at him as if she were making sure this was something she was actually seeing. Knowing her well, I have a feeling that she would react in some way strangely. Finally, she breaks the silence, happily squealing,"Omigod!! He's so cuuuuuttttteeeeee!!" Following her whole excitement, she held him close to her chest, acting like she were hugging him. At least her grip didn't seem that tight on him. "C'mon now Jamie, don't over do it. You might hurt him if you're not careful," I sigh a bit. Well...this had gone worse, and luckily for now it seemed like Jamie didn't have any "funny" ideas.
1553211111111111111.title: Discovered Once Again

15532111111111111111.content:
I held my breath, watching, waiting for the dog to realize where I'd gone and start trying to reach me. But if it had seen me, before it got the chance to investigate, Lily was on top of it, getting Jamie to put her outside. I breathed a sigh of relief. That'd give her a second to get me out as well. This was perfect. I listened to their brief conversation, then saw Lily's face peering under the couch, followed by her arm reaching for me.

I realize just how deep under the couch I've gotten. She won't be able to reach me here. So I start booking it forward, not wanting to blow this timing. But just as I'm about to get to her hand, I hear Jamie's voice coming back into the room taking control of the situation. Practically in slow motion, I watch as Lily's hand is pushed aside and Jamie's replaces it, wrapping around me before I can really think to react. Her hand froze. Couldn't blame her. I definitely wasn't a remote, so I probably wasn't what she was expecting.

Then I'm being pulled out into the light, staring up into the face of who can only be Jamie. I had to admit, she was pretty cute too. But this wasn't the time or the place for such thoughts. I stared up and she stared back while Lily tried to explain what was going on. I wasn't sure what to do. The tension was thick...

And then she squealed and hugged me to her chest, pressing me against her and saying something about me being cute. The pressure was a little disorienting at first, but it was much better than being between a shoe and a hard place. Kind of nice, actually. This was definitely not the worst way this could have gone. A little bit of good luck to balance out the day, I figured.

Pressed against her as I was, I couldn't really say anything or see much, but I did hear a slight sigh that I assumed was Lily. She seemed relieved. That was good. But I didn't really see what the big deal about this girl was. She seemed pretty harmless.
15532111111111111111.title: Unintended But Pleasant Discovery

choices: Well, that's all taken care of.
155321111111111111111.content:
I was quite relieved that Jamie didn't really freak out the way I thought she would. "So...Lilly-Milly, can I...?" Jamie looked over to me as she kept Jake close to her chest. Well..she definitely took this situation better than how I first found Jake earlier. That I will admit. "I know what you're trying to say...*sigh*..." I sighed, knowing her so well. Jamie was probably thinking that she could take him home with her. Not sure what exactly why she wanted to in the first place...but her "fantasies" were a complete mystery to me. "Yeah...so, what's the story here?" Jamie scratched her head in embarrassment after asking that, then wondering what I had to explain this. I noticed that her grip on Jake loosened, signalling that she's calmed down from her excitement.

"Well...that's Jake. He just happened to wake up on my bedroom floor like that, and I found him after he managed to get my attention once he got onto my bed. So, I promised to take care of him until we hopefully get some way to get him back to normal...but I tried to keep him a secret from you when you came over," I explained, stuttering occasionally but at least I didn't sound so out of it. It only took a few moments for her to realize that her dog almost made a snack out of him, I could tell from her change of expression, but it suddenly changed back to her bright self.

"Don't worry, I'll keep this a secret for you two. Sounds good?" Jamie smiled. She'll keep her word, I know her that well. Pretty much why we're such close friends for so long. "So...Er, did I squeeze you too tight? I mean," Jamie finally speaks to Jake, hoping her whole "cute" overload moment.
155321111111111111111.title: Explanation Time

choices: Not that I could really force anyone to do anything right now anyway...
1553211111111111111111.content:
Pressed against Jamie, I had little to do but listen. Could she what, exactly? I started to wonder, but when my mind began wandering a bit...off-track, I decided to leave it be. I turned my head best as I could to look at the girls as they spoke. Lily just seemed sort of tired, like this whole discovery had been pure stress. It didn't seem so terrible, dog aside, at least as far as I could see. Did make Jamie's motives a little suspicious, but how much better did I really know Lily?

Okay. Stop think-rambling. More important things going on.

I listened to Lily recount my own short story, nodding along. She just about covered it, near-stomping aside. But that wasn't too important in the long run... I felt a slight cringe from Jamie at some point, probably when she realized what her dog had almost done... But all in all, she seemed pretty agreeable. Willing to not go telling everyone about me. Which was good. I wasn't paranoid of government spooks catching word and coming to get me for tests or anything, but some people wouldn't be as kind as these two. Better to keep things on the down-low.

Suddenly, Jamie's attention was on me again and I could move again, looking up at her when she spoke. "Nah, I'm fine. I'm a little tougher than I seem..." That remained to be seen, but saying it made me feel a little more confident, so hey. "Uh, nice to meet you, I guess. Jamie, right?"

I'd offer a handshake or something equally awkwardly formal if I weren't currently in a hand several times my size. "So...now that the dog scenario's good, and we're all on the same page about me...what now?" I was asking myself as much as them. I had no idea where to begin with fixing this mess, and truthfully, I didn't even want to think about it right now. "I mean, I don't want to throw whatever plans you guys had off track. Don't want to be a hassle..."
1553211111111111111111.title: Information and Introductions

15532111111111111111111.content:
"Yup, that's me," Jamie said happily, and I never really thought that she would be handling this type of situation this well. She is my best friend, and I know her that well, so it wasn't like she would go and backstab me by telling other people. Though...I started to feel a bit suspicious about her once her phone started to go off. Of course her ringtone was on with some pop song, but at least it wasn't as loud since that could be already loud enough for the little guy. With her free hand she went to take the phone out of her pockets and read the text, which I couldn't see from where I was, but she immediately turned off the phone and put it away.

"Soooo, uh...maybe we could watch some TV?" she asked suddenly, and it was obvious when she was keeping something from me. If past memories recall, I do remember that she acts like this when she's done something that basically screws everything over. This was one of this times, and definitely this wasn't the time for it to occur.

"C'mon Jamie, just spit it out. What was on that text?" I asked, and knew that whatever it was, it was going to affect their situation on keeping Jake safe until they ever find a way to bring him back to normal size.

"...er, well, remember how I first called you that I was coming over because I thought you were alone here...besides coming here with a dog, er...I actually invited some other people over to have a party here...and then one of my friends that's a part of the group I invited pretty much invited more people over. It's basically like having the entire neighborhood come over soon..." Jamie explained, having planned some surprise party to happen soon, and it's not just a few friends, but probably the entirety of people in my high school. Not to mention that my parents weren't around, that's pretty much the sign that this isn't going to be a usual party too. It would had been easier with only a few other people, but this would be a challenge just to keep him hidden. All of the things that could go wrong, I seriously did not want to think about it.
15532111111111111111111.title: Change of Plans

155321111111111111111111.content:
As Lily interrogated Jamie and Jamie tried to change the subject, I looked back and forth between the two listening and growing nervous over whatever she must be hiding. Finally she explained and I realized I had pretty good reason to be nervous. We had a hard enough time hiding me from just Jamie and her dog. The whole neighborhood in one house? This was going to be... interesting.

I looked at Lily, but she seemed as shocked as I was. I couldn't blame her, but however we felt what was done was done, and I had a feeling this party was going on no matter what. So I tried to calm her a little. "Hey... Maybe it won't be so bad. I mean, I'm small. I can hide pretty much wherever if I need to. This can be okay."

I managed not to get eaten by the terrifying giant dog. How much worse could a horde of people be? "I mean, I'd rather not have to sit in a drawer somewhere for hours.
